name: Premier Inn Cork City Centre Hotel

address: 11 Morrison's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 PF78

featured_question.question: Is there hotel parking available, please & thanks?
featured_question.answer: How far is the parking, as my wife is disabled

answered_by.name: Premier Inn Cork City Centre Hotel (Owner)

featured_reviews.name: stovem
featured_reviews.review_text: Rooms were nice, cool and comfortable. The issues was the restaurant. Took them 20 mins to take the order, 20 more mins for the drinks to arrive and then another 35 minute for my food to arrive, starter and main arrived together which were cold. My colleagues food arrived 10mins later, his food cold also. Restaurant was empty so there was no other orders holding the food up. Food all sent back to the kitchen. Nice hotel but i would eat out somewhere else if staying here. Ridiculous

featured_reviews.name: xxtarniixx
featured_reviews.review_text: My partner and I stayed at Premier Inn from the 24th to the 26th of May and we were very impressed with the customer service of the staff. All the staff were friendly and accommodating even when dealing with unpleasant guests. Our room was big featuring a very comfortable bed, an ensuite with a good pressured shower, the room had plenty of storage space and featured a aircon and heater which was a great bonus. We also loved the convenient of having breakfast there as we had to get up early for activites and no breakfast places around the hotel were open that early!

featured_reviews.name: E9762CJcaram
featured_reviews.review_text: We had a lovely stay at premier inn cork. Rooms are spotless, comfortable beds, wifi and a nice quiet bar/restaurant downstairs. Hotel is centrally located around a 10 minute walk to the main shopping/bar area in cork city! Fire alarm did however go off at 4am (false alarm) leading to a semi evacuation which put a bit of a dampener on things! I was disappointed that staff didn’t offer an apology or breakfast voucher as guests quite startled.

featured_reviews.name: 804cathrynh
featured_reviews.review_text: What a wonderful weekend I've had in this premier Inn, from the moment I stepped into the hotel ( early in the morning due to my flight) the staff were amazing!!! |Ross was so helpful, kind and friendly with me, always happy to help and so polite.  This was my first ever solo trip and I will definitely be returning again.  The room was immaculate and clean, comfy and relaxing.  Thank you so much

featured_reviews.name: Martin Gilje Jaatun
featured_reviews.review_text: The HC-friendly room is spacious, but looks a bit bare. Plastic shower in a tub, and when the floor gets wet, it pools in front of the toilet. Funny clothes hangers are a minus. No iron in the room, but available from reception. Good bed. Tea and coffee is available in room. Breakfast buffet features everything you would expect from a full Irish. No gym.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hello Martin Gilje Jaatun,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're glad to hear you enjoyed the comfortable bed and the tea and coffee facilities in your room. We appreciate your comments about the room's layout and amenities, and we'll take them into consideration as we strive to improve our guests' experience. It's great to know you enjoyed the breakfast buffet. We hope to welcome you back for a more enjoyable stay in the future.

Regards.

featured_reviews.name: ChristineBurns
featured_reviews.review_text: This seems to be the latest Premier Inn in Ireland. When I was last in Cork in 2023 this didn’t exist. The hotel is in converted waterfront premises within a short walk of shops and restaurants and I can’t fault the room or the small restaurant. The only snag is if you have a car. The recommended parking is at the City Hall multi-storey, which is about half a mile away and the other side of the river. It’s also not very practical to stop a car outside to offload luggage. The walk to the car park is straightforward across a pedestrian footbridge across the river and then due east in a straight line crossing just one busy road. If park8ng overnight my tip is to not drive into the car park until after 7pm and remove your car before 8am. That way you get Q-Park’s night rate of €20. Park outside those times and it could cost you up to €44. Putting aside the inconvenience if you are touring with a car, the staff were all very friendly and seem like they enjoy being there and meeting people

featured_reviews.name: Gary Nugent
featured_reviews.review_text:
Spent two nights at the hotel with my partner and toddler. The hotel itself is lovely. Spotless clean, very nice interior, lovely helpful staff.
However the two things which let it down for me were
1. The fire alarm went off for no reason in the middle of the night for about 10-15 seconds. Ended up jumping up and panicking only for it to stop.
2. The parking situation is awful. Obviously there are road works and building work going on close to the hotel. But the q park car park they offer a discount on is quite a distance away. You can actually see another q park out the window of the hotel that is very close. However this is not the one. You’ve to talk past this and several other large car parks to get to the right one. Not ideal for anyone travelling with luggage or a child. Even a drop off/set down area for guests would be helpful but instead I’d to lug everything back and forth. Would not stay again for this reason.

featured_reviews.name: Pelin Hess
featured_reviews.review_text:
Location  and price is subjective to each other. I was happy with both.
Here, I would like to thank Anthony, Guest Relations Advisor and Ms.Conolly, the Hotel Manager for their best efforts for returning my diary I forgot in the room (that I realized 2 days later), as far as to Germany.
I admit it is not possible o reach the hotel per e-mail or phone call, thus my 4 star review; however reaching the Guest Relations Center, would initiate solution to everything.
Thank you Ms. Connolly!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hello Pelin Hess,

We're delighted to hear that you were pleased with our location and value. It's wonderful to know that Anthony and Ms. Connolly were able to assist you in retrieving your diary all the way to Germany. We appreciate your feedback regarding communication, and we're glad our Guest Relations Centre could help. 

Thank you for sharing your experience!

Your Premier Inn Cork City Centre Hotel-Team

name: Leonardo Hotel Cork
description: Warmly decorated rooms in a modest riverfront hotel offering a casual restaurant with a bar.
address: Anderson's Quay, Munster, Cork, T12 DCR9

featured_question.question: Dose this hotel have it's own car park?
featured_question.answer: Yes for about 20 cars the entrance is at the side..it's first come first served though

featured_reviews.name: Janet Molinaro
featured_reviews.review_text: I went down to the restaurant just for coffee one by morning and didn’t have proper payment. The staff allowed me to take the coffee on the honor system; I returned promptly to pay! Also appreciated cold water urn in the lobby when we checked in . A nice touch! Location was perfect for our needs.

featured_reviews.name: B8540WXchristinab
featured_reviews.review_text: Very clean. Courteous, polite and helpful staff.  The location was great.  Restaurants and shopping within 7-10 minute walks.  The breakfast buffet was very good with plenty of choices if you need to be gluten free. Didn’t see bread but also didn’t look.  Lots of fresh fruit, fruit compote, yogurt, eggs, sausages, bacon, potatoes.||The only things I want to mention is that the shower is a tub shower with a very high tub edge to climb in.  We are in our 60’s and 70 and physically fit so it wasn’t a problem. May be if you are disabled.  I don’t know if all of the rooms were the same.|Second.  We had a rental car and finding the parking lot was confusing.  It’s on a busy street so my husband pulled up close and I ran in to find out where to park.  It’s behind the building on Anderson street and you press a button to be let in.  It isn’t very big so if it’s full there is a public lot close by.  Parking is extra for both.  If this was explained in the confirmation my husband didn’t see it.|Third.  This is a busy street.  No air conditioning and when we opened the window the traffic noise was very loud so had to close it for sleep.

featured_reviews.name: bearmom
featured_reviews.review_text: Hotel was clean and service personnel were friendly. We were thankful for free coffee in the morning.  |However the snack machines were ill stocked. |In addition we asked about laundry facilities. They told us that they had a company that picked up and delivered laundry. The cost was 12 euros per bag according to front desk. Three different people heard this price. When we picked up laundry from front desk the charge was 20 euros. When questioned the front desk was no help. Said sorry we were told wrong. Also the paper to fill out to go in with the laundry quoted a different price. |Just be aware that the price is quoted might not be what the actual price is. Otherwise, the hotel was OK to stay in.

featured_reviews.name: paulj576
featured_reviews.review_text: My wife and I spent a night at the Leonardo Hotel Cork in Cork, Ireland.  I can’t comment on the room rate, since it  was included in a Gate1 tour package.  ||||The hotel is located on Anderson’s Quay, directly on the south bank of the Lee River.  It is located about a block east of the Cork bus station.  Numerous pubs and eating places are within walking distance.||||The actual lobby is not very big, but there are several seating arrangements. No issues with the check-in.||||Our room (103) was smallish by US standards and had a contemporary decor.  There was no closet, just an open shelving arrangement.  ||||We turned on the wall-mounted radiator, which really didn’t do much. (Luckily, the room became comfortable, temperature-wise.)||||A long credenza-type piece of furniture had two drawers and doubled as a desk.  A small flat-screen TV and coffee/tea fixings were on top.  An upholstered chair and round table were also in the room.||||There was no safe, nor a refrigerator.  And during our short stay we never really mastered  which switches controlled which lights.||||Our room came with two beds:  one queen (with four pillows) and one twin (with two pillows). They were flanked with night stands and wall-mounted reading lamps.  The beds were quite comfortable.||||TIP:  if you are a light sleeper, you may want to request a room facing the back of the hotel, rather than Anderson’s Quay or N27.||||The bathroom was also somewhat small with minimal counter space.  A hair dryer was in a drawer in the room.  Liquid soap was by ZERO/o.||||There was a tub/shower combination.  Water pressure and temperature were fine once I figured out how to use them. Wall-mounted bottles of ZERO/o  body wash and shampoo/conditioner were provided.  Towels were nice and thick.|| ||TIP:  As is common in Europe, the bottom of the tub is a few inches above the floor, making exiting the tub awkward.||||Breakfast was included with our room and was served in the restaurant off the main lobby.  A full selection of cold and hot cold  selections were offered, including full Irish/English breakfast items.  I was especially excited to see scones, but disappointed that I didn’t see any clotted cream. ||||A blast from the past:  hard copies of the local newspaper were available in the lobby. ||||Overall, we found our room to be adequate and comfortable and would have no qualms staying there again||||For more specific details and pictures, visit the hotel’s website.

featured_reviews.name: Turais
featured_reviews.review_text:
The rooms are okay although a little bit expensive. But the cleaning personal and the personal at the hotel bar a very rude and not very interested in any of the guests. The cleaning ladies seem annoyed by everything and most of all by their job in general and they don't even try to hide it in front of the guests when they enter the room while groaning the whole time.

In the hotel bar I sat down with my parents on a table full of empty glasses from the guests before (11 June 2025, about 6 pm) . No one came to take away the glasses, even though the bar was very empty. The two young employees were just wandering around slowly and never even looked in out direction (we sat next to the entry, not hidden somewhere. Then we brought the glasses away, cleaned the table ourselves and put the glasses right on the bar. Even after that none of the employees seem to noticed the dirty glasses thatvwere standung in the spotlight now or touched them the slightest. Neither did anoyone looked in our direction or came close to our table. After 10-15 minutes without being noticed the slightest we left the bar. The empty glasses were still standing right on the bar without being touched.

I travel a lot in the whole world and in no other hotelbar I was ever so casually ignored myself or had the experience that empty glasses and dirty tables were just overlooked and ignored like that. That was just absolutely terrible service - or rather no service at all.

featured_reviews.name: EmuRowan
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely hotel, staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly . Clean, and close to town. Great buffet breakfast. We stayed for a concert.|Only point would be that Security needs to be improved for both staff and guests, key access to lift and front doors after a certain time should be considered.

featured_reviews.name: Ryan Culley
featured_reviews.review_text: Staff are amazingly cool and helpful, super cheerful and sound. Honestly makes the trip, cause when you’re somewhere new, knowing you have great people where you’re staying is so stress relieving! The location is perfect and the breakfast is amazing quality and it’s all you can eat for €13 per day! Would highly recommend. The 2 ladies on the desk on the desk on the 01/05/25 were so lovely.

featured_reviews.name: Flynnic
featured_reviews.review_text: A great hotel in the heart of the city but on the edge zo very little noise  it was Easter weekend the staff were brilliant all round, an elderly gentleman took a bad turn and the barman and manageress leapt into action and took him to a private area to assist him. Well Done! The breakfast was brilliant. Nice and warm, but some of us like the breakfast really hot, please put in a microwave.  Room was spotless, hotel was spotless, staff were very friendly from reception to room cleaners. A lovely touch was giving out free Easter eggs to any kids at breakfast on Easter Sunday. 10 mins walk from the city centre, secure (paid)  parking. In my opinion one of the best city centre hotels.

name: Moxy Cork
address: Camden Quay, Shandon, Cork, T23 C2RR

featured_question.question: Does the hotel have 13A sockets in rooms with USB charger outlets?

featured_reviews.name: PaddyMulligan
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed for one night. |Lovely staff. All young and enthusiastic. Great welcome at check in. Room small but very well laid out and got everything you need other than tea / coffee ( which apparently is just about to be introduced). |Very good night sleep in a comfortable bed. |Breakfast very good in the morning with plenty of choice. |Would definitely recommend staying here when visiting Cork. Overlooking the river and a very short walk over the bridge into town. Another bonus two great traditional pubs directly behind the hotel. |What’s not to like ?!?

featured_reviews.name: DebbieP842
featured_reviews.review_text: This hotel was superb, and the employees were excellent.  The location is perfect with restaurants, shopping, and tour pick-up points very close.  Our first room was beautiful, with plenty of room for luggage without injuring your shins or toes.  We stayed a few nights for the vacation part of the trip, then had to switch rooms for the business part of the trip.  I want to warn anyone considering this hotel that the rooms booked by my husband's company were the small rooms.  The word small as a descriptive word is being generous.  It will be very uncomfortable unless you have very little luggage because your trip is short.  We were in Ireland for 10 days, so we each had a large suitcase, and I was sure I would have to move it to the hallway to open it.  The room was very nice and clean, but wow.  It was tiny.  Especially compared to the previous room.  But, with that in mind, if you have just a backpack or small carry-on bag, you shouldn't damage too many body parts maneuvering around the room.  The employees were outstanding, and because of the beautiful hotel's location, I had to give it five stars just for those reasons.  However, I feel I needed to warn about the small rooms.  Go for the bigger rooms if they're available.

featured_reviews.name: Feisty Grandma
featured_reviews.review_text:
Very new hotel as of six weeks ago. Clean. The size is sufficient for our needs. European hotels are typically small. We have found Irish ones to be as well. The room size, however, is sufficient for our needs. Very family friendly with games in the spacious lobby. Fun decor. Walking distance to good pubs and restaurants.

Cons:
The bathroom light is motion sensored with no way to change it off. So if you enter in the dead of night, you are blinded by bright lights, that don’t turn off for ten minutes. Whoever thought this was a good idea should be sent to do the laundry for the next twenty years! Also, there is no safe in the room.

featured_reviews.name: Triciatravelling
featured_reviews.review_text: We stayed at The Moxy Cork for 4 nights, primarily for a golf weekend and to see The Stereophonics in concert. The hotel is really centrally located, easy to walk to the station, the city attractions and the English market. The Moxy is quirky, the bar area is very casual, with games like Jenga and table football around for all to play.  The decor is modern industrial, and has been very well designed. The staff are efficient and friendly, any minor issues have been dealt with quickly and they couldn’t have been nicer or more welcoming.|The bedrooms are compact, clean and perfectly ample for a few nights city stay. The shower is powerful, and towels are big and fluffy.  If I have any criticism at all it would be that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, something we were told was due to be rectified very soon. |We enjoyed some late night pizzas and very tasty breakfasts at the hotel. In short, great hotel, lovely staff, would recommend! We will be back

featured_reviews.name: delmarvamom
featured_reviews.review_text: The location is good as there are many restaurants and pubs nearby. The Paddywagon tour bus was a block or two away. The bar and breakfast area are comfortable and modern. The breakfast is a buffet for a charge. If you want a smaller bite, I didn’t see much nearby. The decor is industrial, with fake graffiti and geared to a youthful audience. Our twin room was small with little floor space. The beds had sharp edged corners that bruised and bloodied me over our 3 days. Watch out. The best part were the friendly staff. They made it welcoming.

featured_reviews.name: Trevor Rhodes
featured_reviews.review_text: Yes, it is only 3 star hotel and you get no kettle, no easy chair, no conventional wardrobe, no usable desk,  no safe, no restaurant, and a basic breakfast. But it has splendid views and it is in a very good position for the city centre, shops and public transport. Although small, the rooms are clean and modern. The unconventional reception arrangements are quite responsive and seem to work well. Overall the hotel rates are a bit on the expensive side.

featured_reviews.name: Nate ON8 Productions
featured_reviews.review_text:
We came here as a family. We were warmly greeted by the staff and management. They were were helpful and accommodating.

We requested a quieter room or a room a way front the street. They put us in a quiet room.

The gyms was a welcomed addition.

The common area was perfect way to unwind at the end of a busy day of touring the city. We played a few games and chatted with a few tourists.

The team was informative. They made a few good suggestions as to what to see and do.

experience_details.name: Hotel highlights
experience_details.value: Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Child-friendly, Great value
Rooms, Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food and drinks, Noteworthy details

featured_reviews.name: th254
featured_reviews.review_text: New and clean property, but postage stamp sized rooms that look like they were designed to be a college dorm room. Also don’t bother with an upgrade as it will get you a sliver view of the river. The room was so small we barely had room for us and our luggage (no closet just a weird wire grid on the wall with hangers). The location is good and the breakfast isn’t bad, but honestly just skip this place. It might be a deal at a third the price. Also the staff was not knowledgeable of the local transportation and cost us several hours and aggravation in planning a trip to nearby Kinsale.

name: The Metropole Hotel

address: MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 PX44

featured_question.question:
Good Morning,

We have a group of 40 adults traveling to Cork for the International Music Festival at the end of April, 2020.

Will you please connect me with a group sales representative for 14 rooms plus breakfast?

Thank you,
Patty Fleming

featured_reviews.name: patriciafU2606OV
featured_reviews.review_text: Hot Water: On checking into our room I went to use the bathroom.I went to wash my hands with the hot water, the water which came from the tap was of a brown colouring. When I went to dry my hands with the towel on the holder; I removed the towel and along with the towel came the holder from the wall; broken. I asked my sister to look at the water she clearly confirmed the water was brown. I went to check the hot water tap in the bath and the same thing happened. I rang down to reception to be told that there is an issue with all hotels in Cork and to let the water run for a few minutes and it will be fine. Not acceptable on any level. We met friends in the evening that were staying in 6 different locations in Cork I asked if anybody else having this issue to be told by each and every one of them NO. This issue of having brown water coming from the hot tap continued through the stay.|Breakfast: On check in went to book breakfast for the Sun at 7.30am to be told that there is no breakfast on a Sun until 8am it clearly states on the website that breakfast begins at 7.30am. I said this to the lady in reception to be given a shrug of her shoulders and we were offered a packed breakfast which we accepted. On Sun when we went to check out breakfast was clearly been severed. I questioned why we were unable to book breakfast for the time as it was been served I was told that because we were not part of a tour we were unable to get an early breakfast. This is not good enough why are certain clients getting preference over others?|Condition of the room: From the photos which I have attached there is no way in any hotel that the level of cleanliness we received in the hotel rooms was acceptable. The dampness in the bathroom, the dirt around the shelving in the bathroom and bed room, the state of the coving and the dirt on it and in particular the dirt around the window and on the curtains was the worst that I have ever encountered in any hotel photos below say it all.

featured_reviews.name: Yuffd
featured_reviews.review_text: Had room with double bed and asked re upgrade to one with king bed and willing to pay the extra but was informed there were no beds bigger than double in the hotel. Our room was on the front overlooking the street but as windows were single glazed we might as well have slept on the street. No sleep was had with constant noise from late revellers.

featured_reviews.name: BOLSHEF
featured_reviews.review_text: We stayed here for two nights in early April.  It's in a good location near various bars and restaurants.  There were renovations happening while we were there.  I would love to see what the finished product looks like.  We visited the bar to grab ice and the bar looked nice.  Service was great as was the breakfast.  Only downside was only one elevator which was a bit older and slow.  It seems that the other elevators were part of the 'under construction'.

featured_reviews.name: Jordan Crehan
featured_reviews.review_text: The only four-star hotel experience this place offers is the lobby and guest service desk. The lobby was lovely and this is what we expected from the room, unfortunately, we found a hotbox and dated bathroom with poor plumbing. The window in our room cracked about three inches (8cm) and the fan provided gave its best efforts to cool the room but failed miserably. I would stay here again if the price point was worth the room we received. This place over-promised and seemed to under-deliver.

featured_reviews.name: Niamh Mallen
featured_reviews.review_text:
We had such a lovely stay at The Metropole in Cork. The hotel itself is beautiful— Our room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable, and the location was ideal for exploring the city.
But what truly made our experience stand out was the service, especially from Emily at the front desk. She was an absolute gem—always smiling, warm, and welcoming. She recognised us every time we came through the lobby and made a real effort to make us feel at home. It’s that kind of personal touch that takes a stay from good to unforgettable.
We would absolutely return and highly recommend The Metropole to anyone visiting Cork. A lovely hotel with staff who genuinely care.

featured_reviews.name: Nyargoloo
featured_reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff provided excellent service, always going above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable. I also received some great tips for exploring the area, which made my trip even better. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!||Top-Notch Hospitality and Great Local Tips!

featured_reviews.name: cezmund
featured_reviews.review_text: Very well positioned, right on the rover front and in a characterful street full of bars, restaurants and cafes and only a five minute walk over the bridge into the main shopping area of Cork. Easy to park outside to check in before using the adjacent car park, with discounted parking rates for hotel guests. Excellent lobby area with very friendly staff (Martin was very helpful), lovely bar area where we enjoyed drinks and a charcuterie board ( included in our room rate). Good bedroom, not huge but nicely finished, perhaps bathroom needs a little attention to refine. Lovely breakfast room and excellent buffet breakfast, very varied, and great selection of hot foods. All in all a very good city centre hotel and reasonable price.

featured_reviews.name: Rabeya Zarfeshan
featured_reviews.review_text:
We have visited cork for 1 night and stayed in Metropole hotel.
The service was good, staff was so friendly and helping, room was big and spacious with all the amenity. we have opted for complementary breakfasts. The service at the breakfast was awesome and taste of the dishes was authentic and flavourful.

name: The Imperial Hotel & SPA
description: Refined hotel with upscale rooms, a chic spa and varied dining, including afternoon tea.
address: 76 S Mall, Street, Cork, T12 A2YT

featured_question.question: Is there bath robes in the rooms
featured_question.answer: Yes. There are bath robes in the rooms

featured_reviews.name: Ivan Merc
featured_reviews.review_text: We had wonderful experiences in Imperial hotel. Started with Irena welcoming us at the desk. She set the tone and from there on we loved our stay. Rooms were lovely, although historic. Hotel is a small museum of all the famous people that stayed there in a past. Loved that Victorian feeling as soon as you walk in. Cleanliness was very good and no issues there. F&B was a different story. Disappointing at best. However, if in Cork, I would choose this hotel again.

featured_reviews.name: Beatriz Garcez
featured_reviews.review_text: I’ve just been to Helena’s restaurant. I had a lovely lunch using a gift card I received. Delicious food and excellent service. The location is incredible, in the city centre but on street that is not so busy. The place is incredibly beautiful and the service is great, all staff were very kind.

featured_reviews.name: Deedoc3
featured_reviews.review_text: Fabulous bar wonderful selection of cocktails  atmosphere was amazing the music everything about the bar was amazing.. Small cramped bedroom it wouldnt suit 2 people  .Creaky bedroom floor boards.bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was in need off a revamp.air con was poor.Very outdated for the price charged .breakfast was lovely .excellent variety on offer.would love to stay again of room was updated .

featured_reviews.name: Lucy Ferraro - Acosta
featured_reviews.review_text:
I want to share the information I wish I had before booking.

We’re here celebrating our honeymoon after getting married on the Isle of Skye and booked the Michael Collins Suite. While initially lovely, it’s not a true suite; compact room overall, with a stylish but cramped bathroom.

A few major disappointments:
The bed: Advertised as a king, it’s clearly two twins pushed together. While this may be common in Europe, it is usually stated in the room description. The dip between the beds made it difficult to sleep comfortably and felt like a cheap shortcut.

The Vitality Suite/Escape Spa: The dressing rooms reeked of mildew and wet towels; it was an unbearable stench. The spa itself had visible mold, stains, and worn-down facilities. We turned around and left.

Housekeeping and Cleanliness: We returned at 4pm to find our room “cleaned” but the door had been left ajar, with the lock engaged so it couldn’t close. Anyone could have walked in. When we reported it to the manager, Brenda, her response was a casual, “I’m sorry,” with no sense of urgency or accountability. The room itself wasn’t clean: the floors hadn’t been touched, garbage bins were still full, and the bed was made with sheets that had holes.

To top it all off, our coffee machine was broken and we had to get someone to come look at it to confirm that it was not working before getting sent another. There were houseflies in our room when we arrived; three so far. For a room marketed as one of the hotel’s best, this level of cleanliness is completely unacceptable. It only added to the overall feeling that attention to detail and guest comfort are simply not priorities here.

The final straw came tonight when we returned from dinner to find no chocolates or whiskey; amenities clearly listed in our package. When we asked at the front desk, we were told it’s only offered at check-in, which contradicts the description on their website (I’ll include photos). I expressed my disappointment, and the response was simply, “Ok, have a good evening.” For a hotel aiming for high standards, this was a complete letdown.

We spoke with Michael, the night manager. He was sympathetic but said there was nothing he could do. He offered to leave a note for the morning management team to see if they might adjust our room rate, so we’ll wait to see if anyone follows up.

We’re giving two stars only because of the initial warm welcome we received in the form of a card left in our room. Otherwise, this hotel fails to deliver on the standards it advertises. It’s simply not worth the money, and certainly not fit for any special occasion.
As it stands I would not recommend spending your money or time here for any special occasion.

(Photos posted: spa conditions, robe damage, and our unsecured, uncleaned room. And a few others of room details)

featured_reviews.name: Jet17002218969
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed with family for my mums 90th birthday.  Location was perfect.|Rooms and quality of service was excellent.  Particular mention to Cian, who pulled out all the stops to help me cut / box up my mums birthday cake.  He was a god send and went above and beyond with his customer service.... Top man... Thanks Cian. 👍

featured_reviews.name: Kevin Coble
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely hotel in Cork. The building is a bit older, but they have done a nice job making it nice. We received a much appreciated upgrade and were quite comfortable in the room. The staff were helpful, but the hotel seemed undermanned. It took an hour to receive towels from housekeeping. I finally went down to the front desk after calling twice. The early check in policy is kind of a joke. I have never stayed at a hotel where the room was ready when I arrived, but you had to pay €40 if you wanted to use it. I understand if I wanted a guaranteed early check in, but if the room is ready at 1pm, let me in! Overall, not a bad spot for a couple of nights.

featured_reviews.name: Megan Rutkowski
featured_reviews.review_text: Overall the hotel did its job. My family and I were staying in Cork while on vacation. The hotel is old and refurbished but didn’t give me that clean and well kept feeling that I like when staying in a hotel. The bed was squishy and not what I preferred. The room shape was odd as well (long and narrow). The shower was okay. A rainfall shower head but it was a tub so you needed a decent step to get into the tub. Also, the bathroom floor was slippery when wet. The location was within walking distance to many pubs/restaurants which was good. The staff was nice but they were understaffed which showed. Breakfast was enjoyable with a selection of cold breakfast options and a menu of hot breakfast items. I wouldn’t mind staying here again but might also see what other options are in the area.

experience_details.value: Rooms, Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food and drinks

featured_reviews.name: Claudia Monjardin
featured_reviews.review_text:
This hotel is priced very well above the average, however is dated. The facade needs urgent painting and for me since that first impression I couldn't get over the fact that I was ripped off.

There are some nice parts but could be easily priced as 4 stars and not 5, not even the service was up to standards.

Stay at The Dean better value for your money and the hotel decor is amazing!

name: Ashley Hotel
description: Traditional lodging featuring simple rooms, a quaint restaurant/bar & a terrace, plus free Wi-Fi.
address: 10 Coburg St, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 X9AK

featured_question.question: Who were the owners of The Ashley now, then The Hilton Hotel going back the decades.?
featured_question.answer: Information can be found on our hotel's website.

featured_reviews.name: serene clowdus
featured_reviews.review_text: It was amazing. I would have to say the service was what made it the highlight. Everyone was so kind and helpful and communicated with me and it’s really nice just to have good people that can make you feel comfortable and familiar in an unfamiliar country. The rooms were basic, which is OK with me. The hotel had an old anti The rooms were basic, which is OK with me. The hotel had an old antique feel which I liked. They had a living room which I really liked. I spent a lot of time meditating in it. I don’t need top-of-the-line anything I just need somewhere nice where the beds are clean and the rooms are clean which all that was sufficient .honestly thought I just need to add another review or add to my review.. what I really like. Is the home feeling of places I stay and good company and good people. I must say I received that here and that’s what makes my experience is the beautiful people and how they treat you. How could you ask for anything better in life?
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Many thanks !

experience_details.value: Rooms, Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food and drinks, Noteworthy details

featured_reviews.name: Sarah Gerlach
featured_reviews.review_text:
First, the pros: the location is convenient and is walking distance to many eateries, museums, coffee shops, etc. However, it is located on an extremely busy street and therefore is noisy literally all night. Also, the staff is nice, albeit extremely unhelpful. The free parking was appreciated.
Overall, I am so disappointed that I wasted $450 and two nights of my life here. I am by no means a fancy traveller nor do I have high expectations when I travel. I have stayed in hostels all over Europe, and I would have gladly rather been in any one of those hostels.
The beds were extremely uncomfortable, the hotel is very loud (both from other guests and from street noise outside), and there was a giant streetlight shining directly into our room from 10:00pm to 5:00am.
The room is very small, and there is no storage (I even asked for a luggage rack as was declined). There is nowhere to put your toiletries in the bathroom and just a single hook for towels, so the second person has literally nowhere to put their sopping wet towel.
Whoever is reading this: I do not know you, but please please do yourself a favor and spend the extra 50 euros per night to stay anywhere else. You owe it to yourself.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Many thanks

featured_reviews.name: Ana Paula Campos
featured_reviews.review_text:
I have absolutely nothing to complain about. The girls at the reception were lovely, and both the room and bathroom were very clean.
It’s a budget hotel, so don’t expect 5 star service if you’re not paying for it. But honestly, it was perfect for our weekend in Cork, it suited us really well
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: It was a pleasure having you as a guest and we appreciate you sharing your feedback, as it is essential in helping us improve our services. Best Regards!

featured_reviews.name: Laoise Redmond
featured_reviews.review_text: This hotel is a blast from the past and not in a good way. The rooms are incredibly outdated, basic and small. The doors to the rooms use night latch locks rather than coded cards. There is no sound proofing between rooms and it was almost like the sound echoed through the halls. They advertised a flat screen TV, the screen was smaller than my iPad. After walking in and seeing the room for the first time my partner and I agreed to go out so as to avoid being in the room. The car park was very small and strangely laid out, so if you do make the mistake of staying here be careful pulling in and out. We booked this last minute to attend a funeral and if we hadn't been in a pinch under no circumstances would we have stayed here and will not stay there again. Staff were very friendly.

featured_reviews.name: FarAway01009076762
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely and helpful staff! Hotel is in the perfect location to explore Cork City. ||The rooms are quite simple but also has everything you need for a quick stay in town. I do recommend this place. ||A bonus is the music pub just on the other side of the street!

featured_reviews.name: Paul Jensen
featured_reviews.review_text:
This place is great and definitely underrated.
The staff is VERY kind and helpful!
The hotel itself (while a little dated) is clean, organized, and in a great spot in the city of Cork!
I'd recommend this place to anyone!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your review Paul!

featured_reviews.name: Georgina Estella
featured_reviews.review_text: Location is ideal, walking distance or short bus ride to everything you need. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are not the most modern but it was clean and had amenities such as kettle and hair dryer.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Many thanks

featured_reviews.name: nicholee835
featured_reviews.review_text: Everything was great, i’ll say the best was the customer service. Every employee here was just so kind helped us so much. Just good people amazing people. It’s always great to meet people that make you feel like you’re Home even in a unfamiliar country.

name: Clayton Hotel Cork City
description: Riverside hotel with modest rooms offering casual Asian dining, an indoor pool & a fitness centre.
address: 10 Lapp's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 RD6E

featured_question.question: Is there parking?
featured_question.answer: There is a parking garage underneath the hotel. The hotel validates the parking and charges $12/night.

featured_reviews.name: Hank Chambers
featured_reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel.  The room was a bit dated with stained carpet, but roomy and comfortable beds.  Fantastic health club for fitness.  Had a terrible experience in their restaurant and would not recommend, especially since there are so many great restaurants within walking distance.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Hank,

Thank you once again for your kind feedback and further to the recent e- mail correspondence we shared, we do very much look forward to welcoming you back to Clayton Hotel Cork City sometime in the future.

Kind regards,


Jonathan Wallace
Deputy General Manager

featured_reviews.name: Amritha93
featured_reviews.review_text: I was there for 2 nights. The place was great and the staff were very pleasant. The food at the restaurant was very good. The room we stayed was clean and comfortable. Good value for the price we paid. The location is very good as well. All in all it’s a great place and I would go there ago.

featured_reviews.name: Abigail Cissy
featured_reviews.review_text: Emma at reception was really helpful and kind, she gave us a lovely view and a balcony which I very much appreciated. The room was really clean and spacious, many thanks to the accommodation team. Breakfast was really good also. Will definitely be back again!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:

We hope we'll have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Clayton Hotel Cork City at some point in the future.

featured_reviews.name: Kari Cochrane
featured_reviews.review_text: The location was excellent. We could walk to the shopping area and we had a view of the river. Our room was huge. The staff were very kind and helpful. The gym was a real gym, not a little hotel gym. The reason I gave a 9 and not a 10 was the toiletries were very basic.

We appreciate your feedback and are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Your point about the toiletries has been duly noted and will be discussed with senior management.

Thank you again for your kind review and in the meantime, we hope we'll have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Clayton Hotel Cork City at some point in the future.

Deputy General Manager

featured_reviews.name: anthony gallagher
featured_reviews.review_text: We had a great stay at the Clayton hotel. The location is perfect for cork city centre as it’s just a few minutes walk to the bars and restaurants but is also nice and quiet. The views of the river are nice and the room was super clean with good air conditioning. We would definitely recommend
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Anthony,

Thank you again for your kind review and in the meantime, we hope we'll have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Clayton Hotel Cork City at some point in the future.

featured_reviews.name: 541anua
featured_reviews.review_text: A friendly face at the beginning of your stay is what makes hotels memorable and Emma from reception most definitely put a smile on my friends and I’s faces. She was an absolute pleasure to meet, she was cheerful, she informed us about the area. She was truly delightful. The location was also very close to town and the event I was attending.

featured_reviews.name: Jacqueline Farr
featured_reviews.review_text:
Aside from the clerk who checked us in being abrupt and everything was my  fault, did not make things easy.

My husband is an early riser & still suffering a little bit from jet lag, went down the next morning to the main area to find coffee. There was a young man who was extremely helpful and gave him some coffee even though breakfast wasn't quite ready to be served.

A little later that morning, my husband complimented the young man to the same clerk that checked us in. She went on and on about how he shouldn't have done that and how she was going to have to "instruct the staff" not to do that again. Geez... she would not shut up about it. My husband, thinking that he was doing a good thing by complimenting a staff member, felt absolutely awful that he may have gotten that young man in trouble.

There was a different young woman during breakfast, who got to know my husband. She was awesome. By the way, the breakfast buffet is phenomenal!

The service in the main restaurant was not good. After sitting there for about 10 min., we finally had to flag down a woman to get service - to just get something to drink. And the restaurant wasn't busy with maybe 4 other couples there. The tea I ordered was just water - there was no tea, and it took forever to get the food. The food, once we got it, was good.

Then we had to try to find someone to get our ticket so we could pay for our meal. When we tried to charge it to our room, the young lady said we couldn't charge to your room. I went to the front desk to the same clerk that checked us in, and she said, "You didn't give me a credit card." My response was,"You didn't ask for one." I was just too fed up to say anymore.

The room was great, but the beds and the pillows are incredibly hard. Nothing fluffy to them. The housekeeping staff was very nice and helpful.

featured_reviews.name: Kelsey Duckworth
featured_reviews.review_text:
Had a 3 night stay here. The hotel is nice & clean staff are are super nice & friendly.
The breakfast was amazing everyday & left the buffet ready to pop.
We had a balcony room overlooking the river but the way it’s designed meant it was noisy at night when windy.
The gym is very well equipped & the pool & sauna steam rooms lovely & clean.
Recommended to stay here
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Guest
Thank you for leaving a review of your recent stay at Clayton Hotel Cork City. We appreciate your feedback and are delighted that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for sharing your lovely pictures too! 

We hope to welcome you back to Clayton Hotel Cork City in the near future!

Kind Regards,
Klaudia
Operations Manager

name: Maldron Hotel Shandon Cork City
description: Contemporary rooms with free Wi-Fi in a modern hotel with relaxed dining, an indoor pool & a gym.
address: 11 John Redmond St, Shandon, Cork, T23 A9TF

featured_question.question: Can I cancel or amend my booking?
featured_question.answer:
Yes, Maldron Hotel Shandon Cork City offers free cancellation up to 2pm on the day of arrival for almost all reservations made on www.maldronhotels.com or www.maldronhotelshandoncorkcity.com. Some special offers and key dates may specify a special cancellation policy, these will be clearly outlined in the terms & conditions.

Reservations booked on third party websites and online travel agents have their own cancellation policies, please refer to your confirmation email.

featured_reviews.name: Marian Coy
featured_reviews.review_text: If I could give more than 10 out of 10 I would.   I have to say I was so pleasantly surprised.  From the lovely genuine welcome at Reception when I checked in, to the very friendly and accommodating service at the bar, restaurant and breakfast area.  The room was superb, airy and clean.  There were ample towels and a large assortment of tea and coffee and biscuits.  The hotel is situated in such a lovely neighbourhood and only a few minutes walk from the City.  I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to all my friends and colleagues.  Well done to all the staff, you are a great team.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Marian,

Thank you so much for the heart warming review of Maldron Shandon Cork hotel. We are so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay, welcome, room and our staff hospitality. We looking forward welcoming you back soon.

Sincerely,
Mantas Kriauciunas
Front office manager

Rooms, Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food and drinks, Noteworthy details

featured_reviews.name: 342richardb342
featured_reviews.review_text: Our family spent a wonderful 4 nights here in early April. Booked two connecting rooms so the little one could sleep while the adults stayed up. Rooms were clean and comfortable with lovely beds and all the usual amenities. Excellent breakfast selection with hot items regularly refreshed and items that could be requested. Children well looked after too. Pleasant bar and relaxed dining area where we all enjoyed a very nice meal after a long day sightseeing.|Staff in all areas were delightful, pleasant and helpful which speaks to a well managed operation. All in all, what one expects in a good hotel and makes for a memorable holiday. (Freakishly good weather for the visit also helped.)  We will be back to this city of my ancestors and this is where we'll stay.|Only weakness is the small car park but the public option is just a short walk (but longer by car).

featured_reviews.name: Cathy Coady
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely hotel. Lovely staff super friendly.   Rooms were a little small as bathroom and car park is first come first served..it's a small car park. So I would advice anyone if they get a car space when they arrive leave your car there because if you move the car there's no guarantee you'll get a space when you get back. There is an over flow car park behind but there's a charge on that. The food was amazing breakfast and dinner and the chef came out with the food which we thought was lovely and it gave that personal touch. We would stay again as it's walking distance of the shops English market and train station weather permitting
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Cathy,

Thank you so much for your lovely review of Maldron Shandon hotel. We are very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and our staff hospitality. We hoping to see you back to Maldron Shandon soon.

Sincerely,
Mantas Kriauciunas
Front office manager

featured_reviews.name: Ruth Corcoran
featured_reviews.review_text: We booked a baby shower in the hotel, from start to finish the staff were brilliant to deal with. From ease of booking, to the efficency of the staff and cleanliness of hotel I couldn't recommend enough. The food was beautiful and nothing was too much for the staff. A special thanks to vivenne who went the extra mile to ensure we had everything we needed. Will definitely return. Thanks to all who were working today
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Ruth,

Thank you for the heart warming review of our hotel and family gathering facilities. We are glad that you enjoyed your celebrations with us and our staff hospitality. We looking forward welcoming you back in the future.

Sincerely,
Mantas Kriauciunas
Front office manager

featured_reviews.name: Kelsie Bader
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed here for one night and the staff were incredibly friendly! We were able to check in early and before we checked out they let us keep our luggage there while we explored the city. The room was very spacious. No mini fridge or microwave, but they did have a portable fan that we used. They do have a pool also. Located on a hill it certainly made for a hefty walk with a suitcase, but there is a bus stop very close by.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Kelsie

Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.

Sincerely,

Cathrina Mulcahy
Deputy General Manager

featured_reviews.name: Martin Gilje Jaatun
featured_reviews.review_text: Evidently a once grand hotel, but it's showing its age, and seems overdue for a refurbishment. My 5th floor room was spacious, but the bathroom unfortunately had a plastic shower (in a tub). For non-UK guests, a how-to for the shower control would be good - see image for how to get a warm (neither scalding nor freezing) experience. Towels etc. are changed daily, but it does not actually seem like they do any cleaning. Funny clothes hangers are a minus. Good bed. Nice selection of tea/coffee and biscuits. Excellent gym with Concept 2 rowing machine, also a pool. Brilliant breakfast!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Martin,

Thank you for taking the time to share your honest feedback. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!

Sincerely,
Mantas Kriauciunas
Front office manager

featured_reviews.name: waylon_davies74
featured_reviews.review_text: The hotel is situated walking distance from the vibrant and busy city centre. |I spent a week at the hotel whilst on business and I was made to feel at home instantly. The staff are the friendliest I've  ever encountered , they really couldn't do enough for myself and my colleague. |The food was great and there was plenty to choose from at the bar. |Vivienne was the star of the show , and her team made us feel at home every night with friendly chat and great service. |The beautifully decorated hotel gives a great history of the site , the staff were happy to talk me through it |I really look forward to my return visit. Any fan of Stephen King will recognise the carpet on the stairs, to stay in room 217 would be a real experience given the tales of the hotel being haunted. |10/10, highly recommended

featured_reviews.name: Alexandria Quintero
featured_reviews.review_text: So easily accessible to dining and shopping areas nearby. The room was a great size for us too 2 adults and two kids. The beds were comfortable and breakfast was delicious.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Alexandria,

Thank you so much for the great review of Maldron Shandon hotel. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay, room and breakfast. We hoping welcome you back soon.

Sincerely,
Mantas Kriauciunas
Front office manager
