featured_reviews.name: Hannah Wallace
featured_reviews.review_text: My husband, brother, and I stayed for 1 night here and had a wonderful experience! The room was spacious and clean, particularly the bathroom. We also enjoyed the contactless check-in feature. The location was perfect.  We had a nice time at the hotel bar in the evening too!

featured_reviews.name: mikeeF7095KI
featured_reviews.review_text: It’s was just so easy. Everything was smooth and wonderful. The room was huge. (Executive room) nice little area to eat and not on the bed. Very very clean and organized.|Central location, easy to get to public transportation. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend

featured_reviews.name: Gabriel Riley
featured_reviews.review_text: I stayed here as part of a tour and I would stay again on my own in a heartbeat! The rooms were impeccably clean. My favorite part was the service! The staff are so nice and attentive and overall just good at what they do. Despite us being apart of a noisy and clueless American tour group, they treated us so well. Plus the location is perfect to walk around Cork!

featured_reviews.name: G5868IXjacka
featured_reviews.review_text: The Maldron Hotel South Mall in Cork is a great place to stay—clean, modern, and just a short 10-minute walk from shops, restaurants, and city sights.||The rooms are fresh and comfortable, with cozy beds and surprisingly roomy bathrooms. Perfect for relaxing after a long day of exploring.||The staff were incredibly helpful. They held my bags for several hours after checkout and even called a taxi to the airport without me needing to ask. That kind of thoughtful service makes all the difference.||And when you're hungry, you don’t need to go far. Just head downstairs—every meal I had there was delicious.

featured_reviews.name: 40patsyf
featured_reviews.review_text: Myself and a group stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and used 3 of the meeting rooms for an event. I was in contact with Lucy a lot before we arrived and she could not have been more helpful. Upon arrival she was very helpful and no query was a bother to her. The meeting rooms were excellent. We dined in the restaurant. Service was great. My hotel room had everything I needed and there's a small gym also. The location of the hotel is right in Cork city & made it easy to get around. Fabio was also very helpful during our stay and everyone in our group was very happy. I would highly recommend the hotel if you are thinking of booking a business trip or need meeting rooms. ||Small quibbles: my room was a bit cold, I had to ring down reception to get the heat turned up. Breakfast was excellent apart from the very watery orange juice. I would prefer freshly squeezed!

featured_reviews.name: jdw123451
featured_reviews.review_text: The only reason I give a 3 is because of the staff who are amazing at the reception. Rooms are average but the price is ridiculous. A room 2 with one person and they charge on average €250 without breakfast.|They don’t offer the €10 discount if you book at the hotel. |Room was right next to lifts and windows can’t be left open because of the smell from the kitchen which is right under the room. |Room cleaning staff are spotless and do a great job. |For the prices I think a breakfast should be included.

featured_reviews.name: GLMS-NC
featured_reviews.review_text: Quaint hotel with a great location. Literally a block away is a streel lined with restaurants and pubs. ||Room was good with a well stocked bath. Bed was comfy. ||Must park in parking garage 2-blocks away. It's $16/day. No valet or self parking.||Nic eonsite bar with great service. ||Breakfast was included and was outstanding.

featured_reviews.name: janedQ9230GZ
featured_reviews.review_text: The location is perfect for exploring Cork. When we arrived, we parked the car at Merchants Quay car park. Avoid at all costs! We got locked in as they lock it up at 11pm sharp and when they say locked up, they mean it!! We could get out on foot!! I phoned the hotel to ask for help and the chap at reception was amazing offering to try and contact the car park owners. As it happened, we got out through the fire escape and a knight in shining armour helped us out of a locked gate. Not good when you're travelling with a child. We thought we'd have to sleep in the car!! Instead, use the hotel's preferred and discounted parking across the bridge.|Room service was average and they were really slow to deliver. |Really comfy beds and we slept well.|It's not for you if you want peace and quiet. We could hear the live band from the bar outside the hotel which started at 10.30pm. It didn't bother us but might bother some people.

name: Hotel Isaacs Cork
description: Chic rooms & apartments with free Wi-Fi, plus a restaurant with a courtyard waterfall.
address: 48 MacCurtain Street, Centre, Cork, T23 F6EK

featured_reviews.name: Mobile23263347258
featured_reviews.review_text: I loved my stay at Hotel Isaacs. The staff was exceptional. The beds were very comfortable, the location could not be beat. Great on-site restaurant. I am very grateful for Francesca for finding my earrings and bracelet and mailing them to me.  Jorge was also kind, but actually everyone at the hotel were super. The staff made the experience so great.  Everyone worked as a team and genuinely cared for each other. They were very happy in their jobs and it showed.

featured_reviews.name: Eksc22
featured_reviews.review_text: We stayed in one of the two bedroom apartments and it was perfect: spacious, very clean, well appointed, beautifully renovated, COMFORTABLE BEDS ABD PILLOWS!!! The location is excellent, a short walk from the train station and centrally located with plenty of shops and restaurants at the door step as well as within a short walking distance.  The apartment was far more spacious than a typical hotel room which is much appreciated when traveling with teenagers. No wait on hot water, the kitchen had everything, and even a washing machine which came in handy after an accidental spill that would have stained clothing if we had to wait to launder.  I highly recommend.

featured_reviews.name: Joshua Fiedler
featured_reviews.review_text:
Hotel Isaacs was an absolute highlight of our stay in Cork. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the beautifully designed and impeccably clean rooms. They were spacious, comfortable, and thoughtfully decorated—every detail made it feel like a refined, relaxing retreat after a day of sightseeing.

The hotel strikes a perfect balance between historic charm and modern comfort. The staff were incredibly warm and welcoming, always ready to assist with a smile or offer helpful local recommendations. Its location is another major plus—perfectly situated in the heart of Cork, we were able to walk to fantastic restaurants, shops, and cultural spots with ease.

The only small downside was the bar connected to the hotel. While lively and popular, it did bring a bit of noise in the evenings. It wasn’t overwhelming, but light sleepers might want to keep that in mind.

Still, this minor inconvenience didn’t take away from what was otherwise a fantastic experience. Hotel Isaacs offers luxury, convenience, and excellent service, and we’d happily stay here again.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Joshua
Thank you for your superb feedback and delighted you really enjoyed your time spent with us. 
Thank you for your valued business. 
Kind regards
Clement Gleeson
General Manager

featured_reviews.name: Christina Fread
featured_reviews.review_text: Located within walking distance to the bus/train station, this gem is a very luxurious suite with a variety of rooms from family suites, to doubles to singles. Each room was beautifully decorated with accent chairs and bedding that matched as well as lovely shower facilities with waterfall shower heads. Beds were very comfy.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Christine,
Thank you for your superb feedback and delighted you enjoyed your time with us. We value our guests experience and are constantly working to further improve the experience. 
Kind regards
Clement Gleeson
General Manager

featured_reviews.name: Courtney
featured_reviews.review_text: By far the very best place to stay in Cork. We stayed 3 nights and absolutely loved it, the rooms were very clean with many supplies cleaned daily with everything you needed. The restaurants attached were lively and such a fun vibe - loud into the evening though so be prepared. The food was amazing, and the view and sound of the waterfall was so peaceful and refreshing. Just a step away from such a busy city, this was the perfect stay!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Courtney
Thank you for your superb feedback and thank you also for your valued business. 
Kind regards
Clement Gleeson
General Manager

featured_reviews.name: julieb00te
featured_reviews.review_text: Coming to Ireland for us for the first time was quite daunting but the Hotel Isaacs took away all the anxiety. A little oasis in a busy lively city. Great room, lovely hotel, friendly staff and delicious food. We enjoyed looking at the art work too. Would highly recommend!

featured_reviews.name: Buttongirle
featured_reviews.review_text: The room was a nice spacious size and the bed was comfy. Dinner here was very good with a beautiful view of the waterfall and the waitstaff went above and beyond. Check-in and out easy and front desk staff helpful in getting us cabs and directions around the city.

featured_reviews.name: Maldoc
featured_reviews.review_text: Comfortable city centre hotel. Modern small rooms inside old building. The rooms are above restaurants and bars, and the hotel entrance is down a cobbled passage between Restaurant Isaacs and Cask Bar. It is difficult to see from the road. The hotel restaurant is Greens, which has a separate entrance off the passage. The passage ends in a waterfall. |Our room overlooked the passage which was used as an outdoor drink and eating area, so was noisey in the evening. The double glazing helped keep the noise down, but lack of air con meant it could be uncomfortably hot. A Dyson fan helped a little.|The hotel staff and Greens Restaurant manager were especially helpful. Nice small bar and hotel sitting area.|The hotel had reserved car parking spaces about 100m away at a cost of €35 per day.|

name: Residence Inn Cork
address: Camden Pl, Camden Quay, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 C2RR

featured_reviews.name: snehalt945
featured_reviews.review_text: Had a lovely short stay at this hotel. The room is like a mini apartment with well furnished kitchen. Very useful if you are looking for longer stays. Giselle and her team were very helpful and always welcoming. We had some issue with adjacent rooms but it was very quickly sorted by the staff. Breakfast is good and location is very convenient. Highly recommend.

featured_reviews.name: kelliesR4330NB
featured_reviews.review_text: The hotel was so clean and stylish.  The breakfast was great and the location was ideal.  The staff were brilliant.  Gisele was there everyday and so helpful.  Not just to the guests but also helping her colleagues whenever she had a minute.  She was so lovely and always smiling.

featured_reviews.name: nwatkins928
featured_reviews.review_text: It has taken us a little time to write this review because we wanted to make sure that we mentioned everything amazing about our stay, and do the incredible staff members justice.||Having booked a room for 2 nights with lastminute dot com, we needed to change the date of our stay to 1 week prior. Despite weeks of telephone calls and emails, we got absolutely no where. Last minute dot com requested a further £800 for the new dates at this lovely hotel.||We decided to forfeit the £200 we had originally paid and booked another hotel in Cork. We spent 1 night at that hotel and didn't have the best experience. The air conditioning was noisy, the room was dirty and the staff unsympathetic. We decided to walk across the city to The Residence Inn Marriott and tell them about the room we had paid for, for the following week- and that we were getting nowhere at all with who we booked with (Last minute dot com)||We hoped they had availability for our final night of enjoying Cork. |That's where Aisling, Triesh and Sam come in!|They spent more than 90 minutes trying to get through to last minute dot com and resolve our issue. They had availability for that night and could accommodate us- but were given the runaround by Last minute dot  com who kept passing them to different teams to see where our money was.|It turns out, Expedia is linked to last minute dot com but from our experience, only in certain situations.|Triesh in particular was amazing at handling the idiots on the phone; she did not give up and finally discovered where our original money was and, more importantly, was able to release the funds to provide us with that night at the hotel! We even had the original room we wanted.|Sam provided a sense of calm over the entire 90 minutes. He was an excellent team player, checking in on Triesh and Aisling, and offering us coffee whilst we waited (anxiously)||Our room was a studio room. It was absolutely immaculate. The bed was super comfortable, a hot shower, and plenty of storage and kitchen facilities. We wish we could have stayed longer.||Breakfast was hot, beautifully cooked. Well stocked. We got to use the gym too and there was a wide variety of equipment, as well as a tv and water machine in there.||Only 5 minutes walk from gorgeous bars and pubs, The Residence Inn Marriott, Cork, is by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. Not only because of the building and the management of guests- but also because of the devoted, helpful and amazing staff that work there.||We will definitely return

featured_reviews.name: Tom
featured_reviews.review_text:
Amazing hotel. Very modern and a perfect location to explore Cork.

Pros: Included breakfast. Included laundry.  Customer service is on point! They honestly feel like trying. All smiles all the time. Very modern AC/Heating system. Everything is so clean... Honestly there are more pros but just know this place sets the bar.

Cons: The street facing windows could be a bit more sound proof. Even with the windows closed you can hear people talking on the street. If someone is unloading a truck on the street, theres no sleeping through that. The semi parking garage cement everywhere vibe gives you a 'bunker feel'... which was an interesting decoration choice.

Other than some nit picking stuff, you'd be hard pressed to find a better hotel in Cork. Id stay here again in a heartbeat.

featured_reviews.name: W7686MVkimp
featured_reviews.review_text: Great hotel. Centrally located, clean and spacious. Very close to the Cork City Centre. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We would absolutely  stay here again!  Highly recommend!!!

featured_reviews.name: robertaQ9585CD
featured_reviews.review_text: The staff was extremely helpful, pleasant and friendly! Great with recommendations for anything. Aisling was very helpful getting the door or elevator for me when my hands were full. Svenja had awesome restaurant recommendations. All 3 ladies, Aisling, Gisele and Svenja always had smiles on their faces and were so welcoming!

featured_reviews.name: Mike
featured_reviews.review_text:
Great hotel and location! Our room was on the top floor with a view of center city and the River Lee. The location of this hotel cannot be beat as you are walking distance from the English Market, City Center, and the Cork Kent station.

We used this hotel as our base to explore County Kerry and Cork for 3 days. Overall, we really enjoyed this hotel and will likely stay here again when visiting the area.

featured_reviews.name: lauriebE282LT
featured_reviews.review_text: A fantastic hotel with first class apartments. The staff are all friendly and helpful, In particular all of the front desk team. Rooms are great and the breakfast is plentiful and of high quality. Location is also top.

name: Cork's Vienna Woods Hotel and Holiday Homes
description: Classic quarters in a riverside hotel offering free Wi-Fi, plus a stylish bistro & a lounge/bar.

owner.name: Cork's Vienna Woods Hotel and Holiday Homes (Owner)

address: Vienna Woods Hotel, Tivoli, Cork, T45 V065

featured_question.question: Is Wedns night dancing presently going on at Vienna Woods hotel please reply.
featured_question.answer: Not so sure Barry. Depends on the season.

answered_by.name: Cork's Vienna Woods Hotel and Holiday Homes (Owner)

featured_reviews.name: susie m
featured_reviews.review_text:
We recently got married in Vienna Woods & I would highly recommend it! We had the best weekend - it was perfect :) and the staff were a dream. I cannot thank them enough - especially Laura the wedding planner who is an absolute legend and made our wedding go off without a hitch - thank you Laura!
The rooms are clean and comfortable with a homey/cosy feel.
The food is 10/10 to die for !
If i could go back and do it all again I would.
The views are amazing!
Our guests have been raving about it ever since!
Thanks all for making our day so special :)
Highly, Highly, Highly Recommend!!!!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Susie,

Thank you for taking the time to leave such a lovely review! We are so happy to hear your wedding weekend was perfect. Your feedback means so much! We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.

Warm regards,
Laura & all the team at Cork's Vienna Woods Hotel

experience_details.name: Hotel highlights
experience_details.value: Luxury, Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Great value

featured_reviews.name: roisinb329
featured_reviews.review_text: A fantastic stay! Every single staff member was an absolute pleasure. A beautiful setting, lovely room, great food! What more could you want. A special thanks to Susan and Courtney at the front desk so friendly and welcoming. Thanks again we will definitely be back!

featured_reviews.name: D7402ZAjohnm
featured_reviews.review_text: A great hotel with Irish charm in a picturesque setting. The reception desk personnel could not have been more helpful. The food was a delight with an eager-to-please wait staff. The wedding reception could not have been better!|The Glass room and other quiet settings were perfect for chatting and relaxing.

featured_reviews.name: Brendan McCahey
featured_reviews.review_text:
Myself and my band played a wonderful wedding here on the weekend. The food and the staff were excellent. We also played for the second day and the food again was superb..
Look forward to back again to this wonderful wedding venue and hotel .
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Brendan,

Thank you for the lovely feedback! We are delighted to hear you found the food superb and staff to be excellent. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Warm regards,
All the team at Cork's Vienna Woods Hotel

featured_reviews.name: LifeofPam
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely hotel, quick stop off for lunch. |They have Easy Go charging facilities there & their lunch menu was lovely. It was quiet there, peaceful with lovely surroundings. |The menu catered for all tastes with an extensive salad menu which is rare. I chose the Feta salad with prawns, it was very nice.

featured_reviews.name: C7178WQkeithp
featured_reviews.review_text: Very disappointing. 220 euros per night Without Breakfast surprised me. No coffee pods for expresso machine in room, not delivered it seems.Then I was told a 10 euro per plate surcharge for room service!  When i saw much cheaper rates advertised with Breakfast i asked to speak to duty manger who ushered me into an empty room to explain that the hotel was busy as was Cork and the rate was " normal". Great start to my visit home. Room was good though.

featured_reviews.name: sheridan2
featured_reviews.review_text: The staff are so friendly made us feel welcome especially the receptionist’s. The food is fabulous we had the dinner and breakfast. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The Hotel is in a lovely quiet location with beautiful surroundings. This was our third visit. I cannot fault this hotel.

featured_reviews.name: jinnkay22
featured_reviews.review_text: "I want to give a massive shout-out to Abigail at the Vienna Woods Hotel! She was absolutely fantastic and made our stay so special. From the moment we arrived, Abigail was incredibly welcoming and helpful. She went above and beyond to assist us with everything, from recommendations for local restaurants to arranging transportation. Her friendly demeanor and genuine care for guests truly enhanced our experience. Thanks to Abigail, our stay at the Vienna Woods Hotel was unforgettable. Highly recommend!" Jennifer & Lillian Kerry

name: The Address Hotel Cork
description: Relaxed rooms with free Wi-Fi in a grand Victorian building, plus a restaurant and an exercise room.
address: Military Hill, St Luke's, Cork, T23 T292

featured_question.question:
Do you have rooms for 3 people .For instance , 2 twins and a double or 3 twins .?
Thank you

featured_reviews.name: Philip Hall
featured_reviews.review_text: Had a short overnight for work, Reception was friendly and I was checked into a large double room, really nice, clean and spacious. Food finishes early and there isn't much going on in the hotel, atmosphere is flat which I didn't mind for a work night but bar staff could be more friendly. Didn't avail of breakfast seen the buffet selection and wasn't appealing.

featured_reviews.name: Liz Hudson
featured_reviews.review_text: We stayed at The Address Cork and were blown away by the absolutely stunning views. It’s perched perfectly to overlook the city, but only about a 10 minute walk to city center. The hotel itself was beautiful, with a cozy yet elegant vibe. The staff were welcoming and helpful, and everything about our stay felt relaxed and special. Highly recommend if you’re looking for a peaceful getaway with unbeatable scenery!
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Liz Hudson

We are delighted here at The Address hotel to read your lovely review regarding your stay here at The Address. 

We have a very dedicated and friendly team here who were delighted to hear of your comments when relayed back to them. 

We look forward to seeing again in the near future.

Regards
Rhona Heggtveit
Reservations Manager

featured_reviews.name: Lovez2travel_11
featured_reviews.review_text: Quirky Hotel, was once a Hospital. Spotlessly clean and beautifully kept.Large comfy bed, bedding and pillows. Nicely appointed bathroom with toiletries. Good hospitality tray. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Grounds very well tended. A 10 minute walk to city centre but all uphill on way back! A little costly given price was room only but a very nice stay.

featured_reviews.name: lindseyhH379RH
featured_reviews.review_text: Booked this hotel for a family treat. We were all pleased with our rooms. Lovely big airy rooms. Lots of character to the place. The staff were very helpful and attentive. Good breakfast. The bar was nice and comfortable. The hotel has a lovely setting looking over the city. It is on top of the hill so it’s a steep walk back from the pub. Taxi’s easy to find. Would stay there again

featured_reviews.name: tanay rathod
featured_reviews.review_text:
The location is great, plus the building gives a very cozy vibe. Room size was good. The bath tub was slippery, almost fell 3-4 times while showering. Service was decent
The breakfast staff were a bit rude there was no one at the counter to guide us to our table after waiting for 10 mins, we went ourselves and the staff came and said we can’t sit without checking with them by the way we were the only ones there no one else, don’t know what the fuss was about. Can skip the breakfast not worth the price.
Rest was decent
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hello tanay rathod,

Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.
Your comments have been noted and forwarded to the department head to help improve our quality of service.
Hopefully this has not deterred you from returning to the hotel in the not too distant future

Regards
Rhona Heggtveit
Reservations Manager

featured_reviews.name: Larry Sawallish
featured_reviews.review_text: An old, really old hotel in Cork.  Rooms are okay just okay. There were wrinkles in the carpet, a toilet that moaned and refused to refill quickly. Parking, while promoted as free is a huge problem.  There is only limited parking.  You are forced park on the street if none is available.  Parking on the street requires a municipal sticker that hotel doesn't offer. If you enjoy staying in 1920s style hotel with no air conditioning, this may be for you.. For me it's a no for going back to it.  It's not a 4 star hotel in my opinion. It's more like a 2 Star.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Larry Sawallish

We are very sorry to hear that you didn't have a great experience in our hotel – our mission is to provide excellent guest experiences, so we are sorry to have let you down. 

We have taken your feedback on board, and we will strive to make improvements accordingly.

Kind Regards,
Rhona

The Address Cork

featured_reviews.name: grahamcP3747NA
featured_reviews.review_text: We extend our sincere gratitude to Cian and Jan for their exceptional contribution to our wedding day, which was truly unforgettable. From the initial booking, the hotel staff demonstrated unwavering professionalism and meticulous attention to our needs, ensuring a seamless and stress-free planning process. On the day itself, their dedication to both us the wedding couple and our guests was remarkable. We deeply appreciate their efforts in making our special day so perfect.|

featured_reviews.name: deborahh986
featured_reviews.review_text: I held a family reunion at this hotel for 60 people. Apart from the various problems encountered, I contacted the general manager in the following days andvwhen I heard nothing back I tried contacting another hotel of the group. Miraculously the general manager of Cork emailed me the following day telling me that she was very busy and I should understand. She never tried to resolve any of the problems I had. I then registered a letter to the owner of this hotel relating all the points (which are honestly outrageous for the hotel of its type) and six months later I have never heard from anybody. I asked for absolutely nothing in return as I will never stay in this hotel again but I would have expected some sort of reply. And this is supposed to be the hospitality industry? Very very very poor except for the breakfast staff. They were fantastic.

name: The Dean Cork
description: Chic quarters in a hip hotel featuring a bar & a gym, plus a rooftop restaurant with city views.
address: Horgan's Quay, Railway St, Northern Quarter, Cork

featured_question.question: Does the Dean have parking?
featured_question.answer: No but there is parking in the train station a 2 minute walk away 👍🏻

featured_reviews.name: C_Morris_Howth
featured_reviews.review_text: An excellent purpose-built hotel in the grounds of old Kent Station, Cork (the hotel is built on old freight yards of the railway station).   Pro-tip - the company might think to buy a highly visible ad in the railway station telling arriving guests to use the back entrance of Kent Station which is next door to the hotel, thereby avoiding a longer walk out of the station's front door up the hilly road (lots of hills in Cork, as I noticed being a Dub)||Staff are very friendly and the hotel has a relaxed, informal vibe similar to the Generator hostels (although obviously the Dean Cork is a high-end hotel, not a hostel).   When I first walked in I said to myself "I'm not nearly cool enough for here" but I was very pleasantly surprised. Staff are genuinely committed to looking after the customers to their very best ability.   Premises including toilets are spotless throughout||Restaurant on the top floor has a great view over Cork (it reminds me of the old Claddagh Grill in the Great Southern Hotel, Galway, back when dinosaurs roamed the earth) and serves a haute-cuisine à la carte menu with a few vegan options.  Service is until 21:00hrs which I liked a lot.   ||Breakfast is cooked to order (no buffet, thankfully) and was amazing at all times||Big plus: the bedrooms have direct USB sockets of the B and C class - this is a big thing for people from places other than Ireland or Britain.||Bedrooms, which are very highly soundproofed, have a Bluetooth speaker and the telly can be put onto YouTube||My bedroom, which was the basic, did not have a wardrobe or ironing board - I assume that ironing boards, irons etc are available upon request||I want to emphasise that for the four days that I stayed here, the terrific, genuinely friendly and kind staff went above and beyond the basics to do everything they could to give me a great time, which I had, and for which I remain most grateful.   One goes to pretentious places where they are putting on an act - this was not the case in the Dean Cork, the staff were really nice people and a credit to the management.   This is particularly important in city-centre hotels (in a previous review I also commend the staff of a Donegal golf hotel but such attentive service is less usual in urban hotels)||Saving the best for last:- the swimming pool is the most beautiful, well designed hotel pool that I have ever come across - it is delightful. I had not planned to use the pool much - that was not the purpose of the trip - but it was so nice I could not stay away.   Excellent full gym and other sports / gym facilities with classes   ||Well recommended - I look forward to returning

featured_reviews.name: Y4110AWlisab
featured_reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing experience in this hotel. From start to finish. Was met by a lovely guy called Cian at reception who started of the day with such friendly and inviting smile! He made my experience straight away! Thoughout the hotel, staff are amazing! I have never felt so looked after in any other hotel! 10/10 hospitality! The food in Sophie’s rooftop was amazing! Also visited the pool the next morning and the guy on the leisure reception was so helpful and so friendly! Cannot get over how the staff treated us! 100% will be returning again…and again!! Also want to mention the fragrance throughout the hotel, it is memorable! Hotel is so clean and modern! Well worth a visit! Love love LOVE!!

featured_reviews.name: Luketjones
featured_reviews.review_text: WOW! What a top quality hotel. We were in a standard room, but it was spacious, clean and had great style. The bed was very comfortable. The Thermal Suite is a great place to relax. It’s a nice touch having Nespresso machines in the room the minibar has a good selection. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will be coming back.

featured_reviews.name: 536yvetteo
featured_reviews.review_text: This hotel looks drab and boring from the outside however, once you step inside the door it's very very cool . There is a Divine smell in the reception area. Nice merchandise to purchase. The staff were always lovely and I have stayed at the hotel a few times. The pool, gym and sauna is fab. The rooms are fab, the Bert Suite is really lovely and the Penthouse is very cool also. Very clean and comfortable beds, no noise. Sophie's restaurant is great, lovely breakfast and pizzas. I would highly recommend this hotel.

featured_reviews.name: Mick Macve
featured_reviews.review_text: We booked this hotel because we believed it would provide good accommodation for my wife who is disabled and unable to walk more than a couple of steps. The first room we were allocated did not have a wet room, as arranged, and so we had to change rooms. The bed in the new room was very low. I understand that this is ideal for some disabilities but not every disability is the same. My wife was unable to get herself off the bed. The management arranged for a taller bed frame to be moved into the room which was very helpful. The room was of a good size but there was nowhere to store clothes. We stayed for six nights and the only available storage was six hooks on the wall. No drawers, no wardrobe. The staff at the hotel were extremely pleasant, courteous and helpful.

featured_reviews.name: O6225BZsarahw
featured_reviews.review_text: The Dean in cork was amazing. We were greeted by Cian on the desk. He was so friendly and funny, and we got welcome shots on arrival, which were delicious. We arrived early so our room wasn’t ready yet, so we went to Sophie’s rooftop. Food and cocktails were fab! We then went to the pool in the morning, a great experience. Overall, this hotels aesthetic and customer experience is fantastic. A bonus for being beside the train station which made it so easy to travel to!

featured_reviews.name: S800NWbriand
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent room, buzzing vibe at reception. We got a suite and it was very spacious. A complimentary shot at check in was a great way to kick off our stay. We were concerned that being so close to the railway station would have caused noise issues in the morning, but we had no such issues. A wonderful experience.

featured_reviews.name: N8652VWsabrinac
featured_reviews.review_text: This is our second time staying here, such a nice hotel. Staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. The overall style is fabulous! We had the best sleep, very comfortable bed and our room was just gorgeous. Really easy to get to as well, parking by the station. Will be back for sure!

name: Lancaster Lodge
description: Unfussy riverfront hotel offering straightforward rooms, plus free Wi-Fi and parking.
address: Lancaster Quay, Western Rd, The Lough, Cork, T12 EF10

featured_reviews.name: kibbe
featured_reviews.review_text: We found the room to be modern, clean, spacious and comfortable. Also very quiet. Plenty of functioning outlets! Even a refrigerator!!|Breakfast was excellent. Many items to choose from and a very nice menu. Portions were very large.|This hotel is located on the edge of the city center.

featured_reviews.name: emerald_jmk
featured_reviews.review_text: Lancaster Lodge is a fantastic place to stay in Cork—stylish, welcoming, and perfectly located just a short stroll from the city centre. The rooms are modern, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable, with everything you need for a relaxing stay.||One of the highlights is the bar by the river—a beautiful spot to unwind with a view, especially in the evening. The cocktails are excellent, crafted with care and creativity. They can be on the pricier side, but the quality and setting make it worth the treat.||The staff are friendly, helpful, and genuinely warm, making you feel right at home from check-in to departure. It’s the kind of place where attention to detail really stands out.||Whether you're visiting Cork for a weekend getaway or a longer stay, Lancaster Lodge offers the perfect mix of comfort, charm, and location—highly recommended.

featured_reviews.name: algarve_sl
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed here for a quick stop but was very impressed. Lots of free and secure parking. A very friendly greeting. The room was freshly decorated and really clean. Very good location in the city. I couldn't fault anything about it. Will stay here again for sure.

featured_reviews.name: RUSLANA Belnitska
featured_reviews.review_text: The hotel is located practically in the center of Cork, with a wonderful view of the river. The rooms are very clean, with a new renovation. The bathroom exceeded all my expectations — everything is brand new, resembling a five-star hotel. Despite being warned about possible noise due to ongoing renovations, I experienced no discomfort — it was quiet and clean. There was breakfast available, but I didn't order it. I stayed with my beloved person, and everything was very clean and cozy. The price was reasonable, and the service was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who values comfort, quality service, and a great location. If I come back to Cork, I'll definitely book it again.

experience_details.name: Hotel highlights
experience_details.value: Great view, Romantic, Quiet, Great value, High-tech

featured_reviews.name: Kerrie Willmott
featured_reviews.review_text:
We stayed here for 2 nights, and perfectly located close to the main high street of Cork, good walking distance.
Good clean room and a good choice of breakfast, and friendly staff.
It was June when we stayed so needed the fan in the room, as there's no AC.

featured_reviews.name: OhioDiver1964
featured_reviews.review_text: I try to be kind and find the most positive experience when writing reviews.  However,  our immediate greeting at the front desk was most unwelcoming (unfortunately I didn't catch the blondes name). She was rude not only to her business associates but also the hotel guests.||The comfort of the room was mediocre at best.  Take note there is no A/C, both the pillows and beds were hard and dated.  The Lancaster Hotel is not a place I would chose to visit again.

featured_reviews.name: Mike Hicks
featured_reviews.review_text: This is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at and definitely at the price. Granted, the rooms have just been renovated but you can tell management emphasizes quality and attention to detail. Well done!

experience_details.value: Rooms, Walkability, Food and drinks, Noteworthy details

featured_reviews.name: Suzy Egan (Suzy Q)
featured_reviews.review_text: One of my most favorite places to stay in Cork. The location is awesome... A short walk to the center of town. The room was impeccable!  Best shower in Ireland!  Breakfast (I recommend the full Irish) .  Parking was free and secure. The staff was helpful and friendly. The area... Was very quiet. Highly recommended... Would definitely stay here again.

experience_details.value: Rooms, Nearby activities, Safety, Walkability, Food and drinks

name: Destiny Student - Broga House Cork
description: Streamlined rooms & studios in a modest hotel offering Wi-Fi & an industrial-chic lounge.
address: Broga House, Washington St, Centre, Cork, T12 E923

featured_question.question: Do they allow delivery guys to go up in your unit? Do they allow outside guests in?

featured_reviews.name: Maesa Hanhan
featured_reviews.review_text: I should have looked at the 1 star reviews before booking here.   The redeeming qualities were really nice staff (seem like students) and decent location.  Other than that, unfortunately, I had the same experience as many others.  No matter the number of nights you are staying, you have to pay a fee for an additional towel, which I did but it smelled so badly, I couldn't use it.  The alarm system jolted me awake at 1AM when I had an early flight the next day.  After trying to go back to sleep when they went off, the alarms then continued on.  No explanation from staff.  I contacted the manager here and received a very short and non-apologetic response.  I knew this was student housing when I booked so I tempered my expectations & expected nothing as far as amenities, but still I would not recommend staying here.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Maesa Hanhan,

Thank you for your feedback, and for taking the time to write about your visit.

I apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay, especially regarding the additional towel fee, the disruptive alarm system, and the lack of satisfactory response from the manager. We strive to provide a comfortable and pleasant experience for all our guests, and it's disheartening to hear that we fell short in meeting your expectations.

We appreciate your positive comments about our staff and location. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us identify areas for improvement and we will address these issues internally.

We sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity to make it right and to provide you with a better experience on your next visit.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Destiny Student – Broga House Cork soon!

Kind regards,
Destiny Student - Broga House
Reception

featured_reviews.name: Alex Bohn
featured_reviews.review_text:
What a lovely place to stay in if you travel with a budget. The hostel, their inclusive concept and their enormously helpful and kind staff overwhelmed us. We had a great time and a perfect place to explore Cork from.
Advise: Use the St. Finbar's Q-Park if you arrive by car and ask for the rebate, we saved quite a lot of money for parking that way.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hello Alex,

Thank you for your feedback, and for taking the time to write about your visit.

 Thank you for the kind words about our staff! We are glad that your stay with us fully satisfied you.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Broga House soon!

Kind regards,
Broga House Reception

featured_reviews.name: Dorota Biedron
featured_reviews.review_text: Great location. Very central, walking distance to the city cener as well as UCCcampus. There's no car park on side but approx 300 m there's a q park. Validate the ticket at reception and you'll get a discount. My was e8 per day. Air con in the room would be handy. Its had to have window opened at night due to a traffic noise.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Dorota Biedron,

Thank you for your feedback, and for taking the time to write about your visit.

Thank you for highlighting the great location of Destiny Student – Broga House. We appreciate your tip about the nearby Q Park and the discount we can provided. We understand your concern about the traffic noise and the need for air conditioning in the room. We will look into ways to address these issues for a more comfortable stay.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Destiny Student – Broga House Cork soon!

Kind regards,

featured_reviews.name: Escape21185965755
featured_reviews.review_text: I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Cork, Ireland. Not only is it beautiful with clean rooms, but the service is incredible! Here are some details:||-The restaurant is amazing. I went for breakfast every day and was greeted kindly and served the most delicious food and drink. One of the staff, Emma, was particularly wonderful, and always made sure I was taken care of during my entire meal. The restaurant manager was also very kind and fun. They completely took care of my special dietary needs.||-The rooms are very clean and the cleaning staff does an impeccable job when they take care of your room. And there are shelves in the room! There is a lot of shelving, closet, and storage space. I love that all of my stuff is organized and not flung about the hotel. ||-The views are incredible, and I love the glass elevators. There are also a lot of nice and cozy places to relax, and the decor is beautiful.||-This hotel is tucked in a beautiful spot in Cork, with very close access (5-15 min walk for most) to many attractions, restaurants, and historical sites. I never had to walk to far to find something fun and interesting to do.||-The front desk took care of everything I needed and answered my questions kindly when I called.||We will definitely be returning to this amazing hotel!

featured_reviews.name: 675bridk
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed here at the weekend with my 3 sisters. We were really looking forward to getting away together to the 4 star river Lee hotel. Upon check in we were very disappointed with our rooms. The decor was very shabby and definitely not that of a 4 star hotel. The chairs were grubby and the curtains stained. We found someone else’s dirty bobble left in our room. They room didn’t even provide a coffee machine just a kettle! I will say that the beds are very comfortable. |We ate in the hotel and the food was nice and tasty - service was a bit slow.|We proceeded to the lobby to have drinks - we were told at the lobby bar that we could only order certain cocktails there and would have to order the ones we wanted in the bar and they would bring them out. I proceeded to do this but when I ordered at the bar I had to wait until they were made. I then explained that I couldn’t carry them all out to which I was told it’s ok they would mind them and I could come back! All in all I could not recommend this hotel- we paid €300 for a shabby double room with no breakfast included. I had stayed in much better 3 star hotels for a fraction of the price. Very disappointed as we had high expectations and were really looking forward to a lovely weekend away.

featured_reviews.name: helenbR1143OC
featured_reviews.review_text: We had a lovely meal (bar food) outside in the terrace. Staff were so kind and attentive, without being overboard. We have frequent here a few times and were never disappointed. Our meal was amazing and we always try something different each time we dine in the River Lee Hotel

This was our first time in Ireland—and in Cork—and it turned out to be an absolutely unforgettable experience. The River Lee Hotel truly elevated our trip. From the warm, humble, and attentive staff to the beautiful ambiance, every detail made us feel welcome and cared for.

name: Brú Hostel
description: Low-key dorms & private rooms with Wi-Fi, as well as a bar with nightly live music.
address: 57 MacCurtain Street, Centre - North, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 CD00

featured_question.question: Olá ! Duas pessoas podem dormi na mesma cama ?
featured_question.answer:
Hi Sabrina,

Our private rooms have a double bed with a single overhead so two people will fit in the double. All other beds are for one person only. 

Best regards

Bru Team

featured_reviews.name: Karlo Kramarić
featured_reviews.review_text:
Reason for such a low rating:

You don’t get what you pay for — or even close.

Let’s start with the most important part:

1. The Room
We booked a 4-bed room — the beds were quite old, and the room itself was extremely small. For four people, it was definitely not suitable. We could barely move around without bumping into each other. Every time someone needed to go to the bathroom, the rest of us had to move. We felt more like homeless people than tourists visiting a city.

2. Lounge with TV
Poorly maintained, and due to the furniture, it looked very old and messy. I wouldn’t even call it a lounge — I’d rather stay in the tiny room than relax in that space.

3. Kitchen
There’s a kitchen next to the lounge. It includes ovens, a stove, fridges, and a microwave so you can cook your own meals. However, due to how everything looked and was arranged, it felt very uninviting. I’d honestly rather pay €20 at a restaurant than cook in a kitchen that isn’t well-maintained.

4. “Dining Area”
We expected a proper room where all guests could sit and eat. Instead, we ended up eating in a small space on high tables you usually see in bars. It felt more like we came for drinks than for breakfast.
If you want a good breakfast, I recommend going out instead. If you choose to eat at the hostel, you can only expect small spreads, toast, cereal, and coffee/juice. To be clear, it wasn’t a proper meal and we didn’t feel full afterwards.

All in all, after our stay we realized that we only paid for the location — not for a comfortable room, a nice dining space, or a proper chill-out area.

The only positive thing was that the staff were polite and explained all the rules clearly.

If comfort and a pleasant stay aren’t important to you, then I’d recommend this hostel just as a place to sleep. But for those who are looking for a realistic price for realistic services — meaning, you get what you pay for — I strongly suggest going somewhere else.

If you're planning to head to Dublin after Cork, I highly recommend the Clink Hostel — a big step up in every way.

featured_reviews.name: Tanja Žanić
featured_reviews.review_text:
If you're only looking for a place to crash and don’t care much about comfort, this hostel might do the job. But if you value a decent stay and want to get what you pay for, I’d recommend looking elsewhere.

The room was tiny, poorly arranged, and felt more like a shelter than tourist accommodation. Shared areas like the lounge and kitchen were outdated and not well maintained. The dining area was small and uninviting — breakfast was minimal and not filling at all.

The only upside was the polite and helpful staff.

featured_reviews.name: Mariella Wilcke
featured_reviews.review_text:
Clean, hot, loud

Edit after 2 nights: room unbearably hot, loud self-closing doors banging all night, so wouldn't recommend.

Functional and clean, fine for a couple of nights if you just need a place to sleep, not a place to spend any daytime in.
Communal areas are clean. Kitchen is ok for cooking only. Has no window.
The "TV lounge" is not the cozy place you might imagine. It's a clean windowless space with a wall-mounted TV and several bar stools.
4-bed-dorms are tiny, dark, clean, functional. Very loud ventilation shaft right outside window, loud even with window closed. Still, it's OK for sleeping so long as you use earplugs. Each bed has its own lamp but no curtains.
Beds are strangely short, even for me - I'm1.63m - and not too comfortable. Matresses should really really be replaced.
Staff are friendly.

Unfortunately, I have to take one star off my initial 3 star review. Room was incredibly hot with heating on full throttle all night. Every time I turned the radiator down, one person in my room would turn it on full again.
Why's the heating on all night anyway in late april?
Heating in bathroom couldn't be turned off at all.
I spoke to two different members of staff about this, both seemed to be very understanding and promised to turn the heating's timer off for the next night. Neither of them did.

Other guests were very inconsiderate - even for a hostel. There is no need to bang the doors all night (they're self-closing doors, so this is, at least in part, the hostel's fault), nor to pee standing up every single time you use the shared, mixed bathroom, and make a big mess.

I stayin hostels frequently when travelling, and I use earplugs, so I'm usually alright for sleep. In this hostel, I could barely sleep 3 hours due to overheating and banging doors all night.
Of course, the hostel doesn't encourage this kind of behaviour, but it is the way it is, and they don't do anything to stop it.

featured_reviews.name: Alo Ines
featured_reviews.review_text: Location is great, also the breakfast that’s included. Before booking, we were assured that, because we are girls, there are enough rooms to put us all together. There was a “problem” upon arrival and one of us had to sleep in another room. Since she slept in an all-girls room it wasn’t a problem but it was the opposite of what we had in mind while booking and it makes you feel a bit played regarding the situation.

featured_reviews.name: Adam Lipsky
featured_reviews.review_text: Very stylish hostel, entry is through a bar, check-in desk is in the back. Nice classic house, looks like late 19th century. Our room had common two-deck bunks for hostels and its own bathroom with a toilet. If you're leaving early, you have to bang the door in the bottom back (next to the cellar entry) and return your card (and get the €10 deposit back). The room was well-heated and cozy. Note there's no parking in front of the building.

featured_reviews.name: Guilherme vieira
featured_reviews.review_text:
You get what you pay for.
Very clean I have to say. Beds first night you can feel it , however you get used to.
Bar was also fine , spend few hours watching premier league games .

Only thing I have to point is , 8.30 in the morning (Monday ) someone drilling somewhere next to the rooms. Even with my earplugs was loud as the building is old and walls are not keeping the noise .

Apart of that , enjoyable experience .

featured_reviews.name: Savannah Richey
featured_reviews.review_text: Clean enough, and I liked that two uses of the key card were required to get into a room. It felt safe, and was very conveniently located. Be sure to bring a lock for the lockers, as well as your own hand towels for the bathroom. Beware that the pre-check in storage actually isn't free. Other than a slight mishap where they changed the room of some of my group members, service was fine.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hi Savannah, many thanks for the great review. We used to leave towels for guests but unfortunately so many disappeared that we had to change our policy. We now rent large towels for 2 euro and amazingly very few go missing anymore. Hopefully you'll stay with us again.

Best regards

Bru Team

featured_reviews.name: dean gillard
featured_reviews.review_text: Was here before so far a very good hostel cannot say one bad word called a half hour before arrival and told the staff had a bicycle with me and were a 100 per cent okay gave me storage for my bike and all very welcoming and any time I told them might have to check out a bit earlier than usual were 100 per cent about that too so welcoming and easy going their pizza and pint special is good and it was good very easy going but well managed hostel they know how to pour a good pint and very decent cocktails and great music most nights of the week I would definitely highly recommend BRU BAR AND HOSTEL to anyone 👍

featured_reviews.name: McWillow707
featured_reviews.review_text: We had such a great experience at this hotel. It’s extremely clean, well-maintained, and comes with all the little extras that make a stay more comfortable. While the rooms are a bit dated, the beds are very comfortable and the bathtubs are spacious and relaxing — perfect for winding down. The only thing we missed was having a fridge in the room.||The service was truly outstanding. Every staff member we encountered was kind, friendly, and eager to help. But what really made this stay special was how dog-friendly the hotel is. We were blown away by the thoughtful touches — our dogs received gift bags at check-in with a toy, treat, and bandana! In our room, there was a dog bed, blanket, and bowls already waiting.||The hotel has reasonable and respectful pet policies: dogs must be leashed, not left alone in the room, and aren’t allowed in the main restaurant, but they are welcome in the bar and breakfast area. We were seated to the side to be considerate of others, and it worked out perfectly. Our dogs were so happy and comfortable — and that meant the world to us.||Breakfast was another highlight, especially for someone with celiac. They offered gluten-free bread with a dedicated toaster, plus individually packaged GF scones, muffins, and brownies. There was also a large selection of hot and cold items, along with a menu you could order from. The only improvement we’d suggest is offering freshly squeezed orange juice — but that’s a small detail in an otherwise fantastic setup.||Highly recommend this hotel, especially if you’re traveling with pets or need great gluten-free options. We left feeling relaxed, well cared for, and grateful

featured_reviews.name: Jamie Murray
featured_reviews.review_text: By far one of the best hotels around. We have stayed multiple times over the years and I can’t fault it . The staff are absolutely superb. They honestly can’t do enough for you!. Management care very much about your stay and experience and it definitely shows. Some of the kindest gestures have been shown to us on some of our stays and it has meant a lot, from sleep teas and robes left on beds because I mentioned I was a light sleeper and didn’t sleep well one night. Every staff member has a lovely warm welcoming smile for you, even if it’s just passing them in a corridor . The food is absolutely outstanding ! I have never received a bad meal. It’s a hotel that is warm and more than welcoming and feels like a home away from home . It is brilliantly run and all staff should be incredibly proud of all their efforts. It doesn’t go unnoticed. So to all the Kingsley staff, thank you very much for always making us welcome and always taking fabulous care of us on our stays. P.s don’t sleep on the cocktails- they are fab!!!! And a massive shout out to Siobhan in the bar- she is an absolute gem!!!

featured_reviews.review_text: Very cool building and the details inside are timeless. The rooms do not have AC (standard in Ireland but they did provide a fan). Bartender Steven was great and made excellent drinks

featured_reviews.name: Rob Playford
featured_reviews.review_text:
Stayed for x3 nights during our trip for the 4 Nations masters hockey.

Tracy (GM), Grace and the staff were awesome.  Always available to help, couldn’t do enough for us on any request (including special sleeping needs!).

A credit to the hospitality trade and made us feel very welcome.

Thank you so much!

Rob
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Rob 

Thank you very much for your amazing review it was a pleasure having you all here with us for the weekend. We hope we can welcome you all back again.

Thank you 
Grace McCarthy
Front Office Manager

featured_reviews.name: Mary19772001
featured_reviews.review_text: This was our third year returning for an annual work get-together, and once again, everything was very good.|We had a lovely evening — the staff were incredibly helpful and attentive, making sure everything ran smoothly, special mention to Rose the restaurant manager and to Cara who helped with the booking. Nothing was too much trouble, and their friendly attitude really enhanced our experience. Everyone in our group had a great time.

featured_reviews.name: Aoileann de Hóra
featured_reviews.review_text: From the minute I arrived everything went seamlessly. The lady in reception was very welcoming and checked me in very quickly. I went to the bar for dinner was met by a lovely man named Brian. He and all the other staff there, went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed. I noticed they were so lovely to all the other customers and made sure  that anyone on dining on their own was comfortable too.  Well done on having such an excellent team working here. Ill be back.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear Aoileen,

Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.

Sincerely,
Grace McCarthy
Front Office Manager

featured_reviews.name: pauljS5883UK
featured_reviews.review_text: Lovely place. |The lift was a tad small , but then again we're a tad large.||Place was clean and tidy. |Bar and restaurant staff were very helpful.|All the staff were wonderful. |Reception team couldn't do enough and as locals great for advice 👏 |We ALL wanted to marry Grace on reception.

featured_reviews.name: markeC1724EA
featured_reviews.review_text: Stephen at the bar was a breath of fresh air. So entertaining. Made us feel very welcome and was attentive and informative about anything we asked. Couldn’t be a better advocate of how to look after a hotel guest. Would definitely recommend the hotel bar here

name: The Montenotte Hotel, an SLH Hotel
description: Upscale hotel with elegant quarters, a rooftop bar, a restaurant & a leisure centre with a pool.

address: Middle Glanmire Rd, Montenotte, Cork, T23 E9DX

featured_question.question: Dinner at the Montenotte Hotel? Any comments?

answered_by.name: The Montenotte Hotel, an SLH Hotel (Owner)

featured_reviews.name: jlburkholder
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed  two nights and found the hotel and staff to be excellent. Room was well appointed, large and comfortable. The  food was quite good with very good service in the restaraunt. The outdoor deck is impressive with a great view of the city and surrounding area, but most lovely is the wonderful garden area on the property. A real treat to add to the ambiance of the property. I highly recommend this fine accommodation.

featured_reviews.name: V2425MZmariap
featured_reviews.review_text: Really beautiful hotel. Very welcoming staff.  Nothing was to much trouble. Reception gave lots of advice from places to visit to restaurants and pubs. Lovely gardens with beautiful views. Lovely terrace to have drinks with a view.All staff from doormen to restaurant all very friendly and always happy to stop and chat. Would definitely be coming back again.  Highly recommend.

featured_reviews.name: AnneDyson
featured_reviews.review_text: This hotel is absolutely lovely - the decor inside is smart and stylish.  There is even a lovely cinema.  The sunken garden with sculptures is fabulous.  There are great views from the dining room (breakfast served there too).  Breakfast great choice plus menu options to order.  Service at the whole hotel was excellent.  We would definitely recommend and would rebook if in the area again.  Our room was comfortable and cosy decor.  Everything we needed only no a/c so did get a little warm at times.  Overall we give the hotel a 10/10.  The staff were so friendly and helpful.

featured_reviews.name: A B
featured_reviews.review_text: We recently stayed at this “boutique” hotel. What a HUGE disappointment. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by the concierge who was just too overly friendly and in your face telling us about the wonderful service we would receive and if we needed anything, he was always there to answer questions. Never saw him again the entire trip. Then at check in, we were given a handicap room….room was tiny but nicely decorated and the bathroom was huge….but….it was really set up for someone in a wheelchair and there was only a cheap curtain for the shower. We felt bad about taking a room that someone else may actually need so we asked to be moved. We were then moved to a regular room….not as bright and light and nicely decorated as the handicap room (felt like a orange/gray colored dungeon) and the new bathroom was ridiculously tiny with a tub/shower combo that you had trouble trying to get out of b  the sides of the tub were so high and no counter space for toiletries. For something that touts itself as a 5 star hotel, where’s the AC?!! The rooms are quite stuffy and if you open the windows, the noise is just too much.  Sucked it up since we were only staying for two days. Then the breakfast buffet….breads were definitely stale and we’ve had better food at a Holiday Inn Express.  Decided to order off the menu the next day….waited over 30 min for our food and said forget it and walked out. They say they provide great customer service but that was just lip service, their actions (or lack of) said otherwise. Gave a two star because of the awesome view of Cork at night. Will never return

featured_reviews.name: Joie-Spore
featured_reviews.review_text: Small luxury hotel under the Hilton brand and well rated on TripAdvisor. Service was excellent, staff was quick to unload all our luggages once we parked and carried all of them to our rooms. We didn’t had to lift a finger whether checking in or out. Check in was smooth and rooms were comfortable though we did not expect one of the rooms to have no air conditioner, as we booked on the assumption the hotel will be fully air conditioned. So do check the details when booking. But it was not a big problem as Ireland even in summer is cool. Breakfast was great - with nice views and Irish breakfast buffet, as well as various hot items freshly cooked and served to the table - the oats were really nice. The hotel amazingly has a cinema even though we didn’t get to try it. Overall a good experience and will recommend it :)

featured_reviews.name: david rose
featured_reviews.review_text:
We Stayed 1 night (22/06/25) for a short break away.
The hotel, location and food were all excellent, but the stand out thing for us was the exceptional service and overall hospitality shown by all the staff.
From the bar staff to the cleaners and kitchen staff, all were friendly, helpful and welcoming.
A big thanks in particular to the front of desk “Jess” who was really welcoming, helpful and polite.
Jesse was also great craic, and made us feel like she wasn’t just “doing her job”, but really felt like someone you could actually talk to, not your run of the mill check in staff - she is an asset to the hotel.!!
I Would 100% stay again and recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing stay away in Cork.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Dear David, 

Thank you for such a wonderful review! I am beyond thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful experience, and that Jess and the team looked after you so well during your stay. 
We look forward to hopefully welcoming you back again in the future!

Best regards, 
General Manager

featured_reviews.review_text: Ken made this hotel even better than it already was. The amenities are beautiful. The rooms are clean and beautiful and the food was great. We would 100% stay here again. We appreciated the shuttle as well, it certainly came in handy because the hotel is located at the top of a hill which makes for a wonderful view but a terrible hike up with luggage :).

featured_reviews.name: Aimee Philpott
featured_reviews.review_text: My husband and I were on a first time visit to Cork City and the wonderful Montenotte Hotel.  We loved the location, the amenities, the breakfast choices as well as our dinner experience.  My specific requests were all honored and provided.  It was a lovely stay.  The hotel is in a neighborhood above the city centre of Cork and if walking, a steep walk up BUT very manageable and well worth it!

Thank you for such kind feedback. I'm delighted to hear that you both loved your experience at The Montenotte. I look forward to hopefully welcoming you back in the future.

name: Copley Court | Summer Accommodation in Cork
description:
Copley Court offers the perfect alternative to a traditional hotel stay, providing affordable, cozy, and comfortable rooms with the vibrant city of Cork right on your doorstep. Whether you’re a solo traveler ready to explore the sights or part of a group eager to experience Cork's lively nightlife, Copley Court is the ideal place to stay.
Our 24-hour reception is staffed by a knowledgeable and enthusiastic team, always on hand to offer recommendations on local attractions, events, and hidden gems to help you make the most of your time in the city.
With a range of excellent features at an affordable price, Copley Court is designed to meet all your needs. So why wait? Check in, plug in, and unwind—your perfect stay begins at Copley Court.

owner.name: Copley Court | Summer Accommodation in Cork (Owner)

address: Copley St, Ballintemple, Cork

featured_reviews.name: KrisK
featured_reviews.review_text:
Dim, dirty and depressing.

Looks really nice on the pictures but grey and depressing in reality, at least the first floor. Also very bad and dim lightning in rooms and kitchen which makes everything feel even more weird and liminal. Sticky floor in the kitchen and two puddles of water in the gym which is very dangerous should someone slip. Dirty gym equipment as well and nothing to clean with. Kitchen lacked most amenities and we had to use a towel from our room since there was no kitchen cloth or paper. Confused staff that didn't seem to know the building or the business they were running. You really got the feeling it was the first day on the job except for one of the young women who actually was helpful. They have no system of keeping track of which parking space is given to which guest so we lost our space on the second night and had nowhere to park. We definitely don't recommend Copley Court.

name: Oaklands Bed and Breakfast
address: 51 Lower Glanmire Rd, Cork, T23 TD00

featured_reviews.name: Tatiana
featured_reviews.review_text: This is a small overnight stay. It is located at the railway station. The rooms are not comfortable. (The furniture is arranged so poorly that it is impossible to walk) and it is impossible to plug the kettle into the socket. There is no way

featured_reviews.name: Alan Murphy
featured_reviews.review_text: Lack of ensuite and shared shower . Place spotless but room I was had plenty or room for an ensuite.

featured_reviews.name: Carrie Lord
featured_reviews.review_text: Firstly, the owner is the nicest woman you will ever meet! Was so accommodating, kind and funny. We actually booked to stay at Clon Ross, and upon arrival was told we would be staying at Oaklands instead which is a 1 min walk up the road. The house was very old, but very homely. Our room was small but enough for us. The shower was a decent size, but the door to get into it is very small. The bathroom was not the nicest, there was mould spotting on the walls and ceilings, the toilet seat was broken and the hand soap bottle was a M&S one that was reused many times so had mould in it. But this did not put a downer in our stay! Also there was only 1 plug socket we could find to use. This is a nice place to stay, close to town and the best governess you will find!

featured_reviews.name: LauraC864
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed for 3 nights over jazz weekend in a group of 4. Greeted by Ellen every morning with a fantastic real Irish breakfast and strong coffee. Rooms were very comfortable , beds were made up every day. Traffic noise outside was minimum. Warm shower. Hair dryer, towels,shower gel and shampoo provided. Great location as can be in and out of the city in 10/15 mins. Would definitely recommend !

featured_reviews.name: Mell446
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed here with my mum in early June couple who run it are very nice but the whole place needs to be redecorated very run down, the bathroom could have been cleaner and hot water came out of the cold tap and vice versa, also shower was scalding hot, good walk from city centre but not too bad walking in as all downhill.  The room itself was clean but very basic, the breakfast was lovely though and freshly cooked.  We paid €130 for the room I think it was too much for what we got.

featured_reviews.name: RugbyJuda
featured_reviews.review_text: Stayed here for one night for a funeral. The rooms are clean and the owners are terribly nice and couldn't be more helpful. No tea and coffee facilities in the room but thats not a big thing as I'd say if you asked for one I'm sure they would accommodate you. Beware if your a light sleeper the train sta tion is right behind the hotel. Didn't bother me nor did it wake me..also there is no lift in case any one books the b&b cannot use stairs. Breakfast was lovely the following morning. I would recommend here for a short stay. Very reasonably priced also.

featured_reviews.name: 1Jetgirl
featured_reviews.review_text: This stay was booked for me. The property is older, basic and not particularly clean. I wiped down the shower stall with a wipe that I had with me and brought up lots of dirt. The toilet and the shelf above it needed to be wiped down as well. The walls in the room are in real need of cleaning and new paint. I was hesitant to eat any cooked breakfast items based on the condition of the room and building, which needs a thorough cleaning and freshening.||The hostess was pleasant, but I would not stay here again.

featured_reviews.name: johhnyf2013
featured_reviews.review_text: Had a conference to attend and couldn’t get a room anywhere but thankfully got a room in Oakland’s and it was perfect. Derry and Ellen were lovely hosts and v friendly.||The place is a little bit dated but that actually adds to it. It was spotlessy clean and the breakfast was lovely, didn’t scrimp on the toast or butter either which is always a good sign.||10 min walk to city centre. It’s right beside train station, I had my car and it was free on street parking from evening until 8:30am which suited me. Overall, great value.

name: Yugo Amnis House - Summer Hotel
address: Western Rd, Mardyke, Cork, T12 E2RF

featured_reviews.name: SEONGCHAN HEO
featured_reviews.review_text: We rented a four-room apartment and encountered numerous issues: a dishwasher full of dirty dishes, a non-working refrigerator, flickering lights, and an open utility room door. Despite reporting these problems, the initial solutions were ineffective, and we had to move to a neighboring unit. And during the night, an aggressive staff member entered our apartment without notice. A fire alarm disrupted our sleep multiple times, and the staff provided no apologies or satisfactory resolutions. We felt disrespected and disappointed by their lack of courtesy.

featured_reviews.name: Taeseok Seo
featured_reviews.review_text:
We had the worst experience here. We rented an apartment with four rooms. Upon arrival, we discovered the dishwasher was full of dirty dishes, the refrigerator wasn't working, the lights were flickering, and the door to what seemed like a utility room was open, releasing hot air and a lot of dust.

I went to the reception to report these issues, and later a woman from reception and a man who seemed to be the manager came up to our apartment to inspect. They said the dishwasher wasn’t working due to an error, they would fix the flickering light after turning off the electricity, the refrigerator would start cooling after adjusting the control, and they would lock the utility room door. I requested a room change, but the man said this was the best apartment and since we had already checked in, it had become a private space, so they couldn’t move us. He assured us they would fix everything.

We washed the dishes ourselves and after grocery shopping and returning about an hour later, the utility room door was still open, and the refrigerator still wasn’t working. I went back to reception to ask the female staff to call the male manager, but he had already left for the day. The female staff came up again to check the issues and then offered to move us to a neighboring unit on the same floor, which was vacant and had eight rooms. We were given keycards to four of the eight rooms. We wated time moving our groceries and unpacked items. Although the female staff apologized, she did not seem genuinely sorry.

After dinner, we were chatting with our friends. Around 2 AM, a man suddenly entered our living room and asked how many rooms we had rented. We were very surprised as we had not been notified about this beforehand, but one of our friends answered that we had rented four rooms. The man left immediately, and at that moment, I accidentally cut my hand on the rim of a glass while washing dishes.

I went down to find the man to ask for a band-aid and to understand why he had come in. The man was very aggressive and said it was his job to check if the oven was on and if there were any issues, and that there had been complaints about us being too noisy. He also said it was wrong to use a fire extinguisher to open the door for ventilation. We apologized for our mistakes. We wanted to ask why he entered without knocking or why he didn’t complain about the noise when he came to us, but he kept cutting us off with an aggressive attitude, so we couldn’t say anything. I explained my injury and requested a Plaster. The man continued to ask mockingly, "Why? What for? Did you break the glass?" But fortunately, I managed to persuade him to give me a band-aid.

We finished tidying up and went to bed, but around 6 AM, we woke up to a fire alarm. We evacuated, and other people were also outside. The aggressive staff member was walking around looking for the issue. There was a fire alarm panel next to the reception, and a female guest seemed to check the alarm error and turn it off, explaining to the staff member how to use it. After this incident, we returned to try and sleep more, but the fire alarm went off several more times after thirty minutes.

At checkout, we returned our keycards, and although I don’t know how they handled other guests, we received no apology. Whether they were racist or just generally rude, we felt deeply disappointed by their lack of basic courtesy towards customers. We just hope no one else has to suffer the same experience as us.

featured_reviews.name: Débora Moraes
featured_reviews.review_text: My husband and I stayed at Yugo in June of 2023. The check-in and check-out was very easy and we liked the spaces outdoor with picnic tables to have a meal. Our bedroom was clean, but we missed a bin to discard our rubbish. The biggest negative point was the fact that the noise in the hall could be listened from our bedroom and disturbed our sleep a few times.

featured_reviews.name: Colm D
featured_reviews.review_text: All i can say is i was blown away by this location.  Had to attend a function in Cork and i found Yugo Amnis House so thought i wud give it a try.  Yugo Amnis was very affordable, rooms spotless and nice bathroom.  There was a 'common' room with a TV and cooking facilities well kitted out.  Beautiful view from our room overlooking the River Lee and the facility was very secure.  Bus stop to location where function was happening was only 5 mins walk away    and route went via city centre.  Very nice take aways and restaurants within easy walking from the hotel too.  Staff at reception on arrival and departure were extremely friendly and helpful.  On check out receptionist validated our parking ticket with carpark close by and this saved us quite a bit in parking fees.  I most definitely would recommend this hostel if your looking for accomadation in Cork City - no frills, clean, secure, friendly staff and close to most attractions in area.  I will use location again as i have to travel to Cork once in a while.  Definitel get the 👍😊
